**Q2.STONE AEONä½œä¸ºPlatONé“¾ä¸Šé¦–ä¸ªGameFié¡¹ç›®ï¼Œå°±æ‚¨ä¸ªäººè€Œè¨€ï¼ŒPlatONä¸ºä½•ä»Šå¹´å¼€å§‹è§¦åŠé“¾æ¸¸è¿™ä¸ªé¢†åŸŸï¼Œæˆ–è€…è¯´æ‚¨æ˜¯æ€æ ·çœ‹å¾…GameFiè¡Œä¸šæœªæ¥å‘å±•ã€‚**

**Since Stone Aeon is the first GameFi project on PlatON, in your opinion, what bringsÂ PlatON toÂ the GameFi field this year? Or, how do you look at the future development of GameFi?**

Â Aï¼šAt the very beginning, we talked with multiple public chains, many of which are GameFi veterans.After several rounds of communication and negotiation, we eventually decided to join the PlatON ecosystem, because we saw two valuable characteristics in the PlatON team: rigor and creativity.

As far as I am concerned, the PlatON team shows much vigor in the pursuit of perfect technology and product refinement.

From our communication on massive technical details, I even feel like Iâ€™m PlatONâ€™s â€œclientâ€ rather than part of its ecosystem. PlatONâ€™s capability of engineering practice and technical implementation, which is unique to business service providers, has impressed me a lot.

PlatON is never eager to jump on the bandwagon. Instead, it has been making steady progress step by step and focus on the long-term development. Having laid a solid foundation for the past few years, PlatON naturally set foot in the GameFi industry this year.

The second characteristic it has is creativity. Itâ€™s quite rare to find such a rigorous team with infinite creativity, which can be evidenced by PlatONâ€™s privacy-preserving computation network.This decentralized fundamental system for data sharing and privacy-preserving computation serves as a bridge linking data owners, data users, algorithm developers and hashing power providers, and offers full-cycle data services. Frankly speaking, this is more like a product developed by a large Internet company.

PlatONâ€™s profound technical competence can be vividly illustrated by the implementation of such a complex product philosophy and business model, injecting much confidence into us in the prospects of the PlatON ecosystem.

I believe the industry will focus on the â€œrealâ€ game. GameFi will embrace a boom when users can fully enjoy a smooth, intriguing experience in GameFi games, not for profits but for fun, just as they do in AAA games.

**Q4.å¯ä»¥ç»™æˆ‘ä»¬ä»‹ç»ä¸€ä¸‹STONEAEONçš„ç»æµæ¨¡å‹æ˜¯æ€ä¹ˆè®¾è®¡çš„å˜›ï¼Ÿæœªæ¥ç©å®¶å¦‚ä½•å‚ä¸è¿›å»ï¼Œåœ¨æ¸¸æˆä¸­æ‹¥æœ‰æ”¶ç›Š**

**Could you please explain toÂ us how Stone Aeonâ€™s economic model is designed? How willÂ usersÂ join this game and earn profits in the game?**

Â Aï¼šAs a fully autonomous community-driven game, Stone Aeon has designed a complete economic system and incentive model to drive all participants in the community to jointly govern and create the world of Stone Aeon.

All game products are permanently stored on the blockchain as NFT assets and can be freely combined and traded. In Stone Aeon, prudent investors can obtain continuous and risk-free fixed income through staking, and aggressive investors can enjoy higher returns through competition.

All SANFT holders are members of the guild and will constantly receive guild rewards. We plan to distribute 20% of the ecosystem rewards as guild rewards and another 20% as guild governance rewards.

All game products are permanently stored on the blockchain as NFT assets and can be freely combined and traded. In Stone Aeon, prudent investors can obtain continuous and risk-free fixed income through staking, and aggressive investors can enjoy higher returns through competition.

We will share 50% of the game revenue with these 8,128 SANFT holders, and they can replace the character avatars in the game. Of course, the higher the level, the more profits users can get by staking. 
 All users will be able to mint their favorite characters in the game. They can stake, fight, and trade in different game scenarios for benefits.

**Q6. Is there a mechanism to overcome the so-called spiral death which the gamefi projects always happened? Â have you considered on this issue?**

**Q6. æ˜¯å¦æœ‰ä¸€ç§æœºåˆ¶æ¥å…‹æœæ‰€è°“çš„èºæ—‹å¼æ­»äº¡ï¼Ÿå› ä¸ºä¸€èˆ¬æ¸¸æˆé¡¹ç›®æ€»æ˜¯å‘ç”Ÿè¿™ç§æƒ…å†µã€‚ ä½ æ˜¯å¦è€ƒè™‘è¿‡è¿™ä¸ªé—®é¢˜ï¼Ÿ**

Aï¼šThe primary cause of death spirals is the unreasonable design of in-game consumption, as well as the constant additional issuance and release of tokens.

In StoneAeon, we have created many PVP gameplays to provide a place for users to compete with each other in the game. As the race goes on, resources will be consumed, and such resources will be offered as community rewards and reenter the value ecosystem of StoneAeon.

For example, users may invest SCGT to compete with others, and whether they win or lose, part of the investment will be consumed, which generates deflation.

This part of SCGT investments could be burned or recovered by the community for the distribution of ecosystem rewards or other purposes. The more intensive the PVP system is, the lower the probability of a death spiral.

**Q7. Security is essential issue in the Crypto world, can you tell us how do you consider it in the game? In-game cheating or scripts cross-site scripting is usually very unfair to the other players, do you have any countermeasures or solutions to avoid it?**

**Q7. å®‰å…¨æ˜¯åŠ å¯†ä¸–ç•Œçš„åŸºæœ¬é—®é¢˜ï¼Œä½ èƒ½å‘Šè¯‰æˆ‘ä»¬ä½ åœ¨æ¸¸æˆä¸­æ˜¯å¦‚ä½•è€ƒè™‘çš„å—ï¼Ÿæ¸¸æˆä¸­çš„ä½œå¼Šæˆ–è„šæœ¬è·¨ç«™è„šæœ¬é€šå¸¸å¯¹å…¶ä»–ç©å®¶å¾ˆä¸å…¬å¹³ï¼Œä½ ä»¬æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå¯¹ç­–æˆ–è§£å†³æ–¹æ¡ˆæ¥é¿å…è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µå—ï¼Ÿ**

Â 

Aï¼šBy integrating RealRan VRF, StoneAeon could create gaming assets in a more random way. For example, the StoneAeon staking mechanism is the case to adopt the algorithm of random number generation to ensure all participantsâ€™ fairness and gaming balance.

As mentioned, it is difficult to generate onchain non-predicted random values for the public chains. Currently, most projects normally use onchain parameters as the seed like blockhashes to generate numbers. Although the blockhash is random, it could be calculated and predicted by validators or miners.

For the current RealRan VRF version, We uses the Nonce of the parent block header as the seed and generates the random number with the private key signature of the proposer of the current block. 
 As the nonce is verifiable, random and tamper-resistant, VRF using the nonce could contribute to providing random values for Web3 games to improve fairness.

 
 

é€šè¿‡é›†æˆ RealRan VRFï¼ŒStoneAeon å¯ä»¥ä»¥æ›´éšæœºçš„æ–¹å¼åˆ›å»ºæ¸¸æˆèµ„äº§ã€‚ ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼ŒStoneAeon Staking æœºåˆ¶å°±æ˜¯é‡‡ç”¨éšæœºæ•°ç”Ÿæˆç®—æ³•æ¥ä¿è¯æ‰€æœ‰å‚ä¸è€…çš„å…¬å¹³å’Œåšå¼ˆå¹³è¡¡çš„æ¡ˆä¾‹ã€‚

å¦‚å‰æ‰€è¿°ï¼Œå¾ˆéš¾ä¸ºå…¬é“¾ç”Ÿæˆé“¾ä¸Šéé¢„æµ‹éšæœºå€¼ã€‚ ç›®å‰ï¼Œå¤§å¤šæ•°é¡¹ç›®é€šå¸¸ä½¿ç”¨é“¾ä¸Šå‚æ•°ä½œä¸ºç§å­ï¼Œå¦‚åŒºå—å“ˆå¸Œæ¥ç”Ÿæˆæ•°å­—ã€‚ å°½ç®¡å—å“ˆå¸Œæ˜¯éšæœºçš„ï¼Œä½†å®ƒå¯ä»¥ç”±éªŒè¯è€…æˆ–çŸ¿å·¥è®¡ç®—å’Œé¢„æµ‹ã€‚

å¯¹äºå½“å‰çš„ RealRan VRF ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä½¿ç”¨çˆ¶åŒºå—å¤´çš„ Nonce ä½œä¸ºç§å­ï¼Œå¹¶ä½¿ç”¨å½“å‰åŒºå—æè®®è€…çš„ç§é’¥ç­¾åç”Ÿæˆéšæœºæ•°ã€‚

ç”±äº nonce æ˜¯å¯éªŒè¯çš„ã€éšæœºçš„å’Œä¸å¯ç¯¡æ”¹çš„ï¼Œå› æ­¤ä½¿ç”¨ nonce çš„ VRF æœ‰åŠ©äºä¸º Web3 æ¸¸æˆæä¾›éšæœºå€¼ä»¥æé«˜å…¬å¹³æ€§ã€‚

 
 

**Q8. Are there any rewards for participating in the Â beta? Or will it have any impact on the official launch of the later game?**

**å‚åŠ æµ‹è¯•æœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå¥–åŠ±å—ï¼Ÿæˆ–è€…å¯¹åæœŸæ¸¸æˆçš„æ­£å¼æ¨å‡ºä¼šæœ‰ä»€ä¹ˆå½±å“å—ï¼Ÿ**

Â A:Of course, we will kick off a giveaway event after the beta test starts to give back to users who participated in the test. You can always join our community and find out about the specifics of the test and event.

We will not delete usersâ€™ gaming records after the beta test, which means that StoneAeon will be officially live after the beta test begins. After StoneAeon goes live, we will keep refining the game and releasing upgrades, which is the building block that supports the long-term operation of the game. Meanwhile, community governance will also be activated to encourage all SANFT holders and community users to participate in the future iteration and gameplay design of StoneAeon, thereby creating a truly community-autonomous game. We also welcome more crypto users to the world of StoneAeon.

 
 

å½“ç„¶ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¼šåœ¨å…¬æµ‹å¼€å§‹åå¯åŠ¨èµ å“æ´»åŠ¨ï¼Œå›é¦ˆå‚ä¸æµ‹è¯•çš„ç”¨æˆ·ã€‚ æ‚¨å¯ä»¥éšæ—¶åŠ å…¥æˆ‘ä»¬çš„ç¤¾åŒºï¼Œäº†è§£æµ‹è¯•å’Œæ´»åŠ¨çš„å…·ä½“æƒ…å†µã€‚

Â å…¬æµ‹ç»“æŸåæˆ‘ä»¬ä¸ä¼šåˆ é™¤ç”¨æˆ·çš„æ¸¸æˆè®°å½•ï¼Œè¿™æ„å‘³ç€StoneAeonå°†åœ¨å…¬æµ‹å¼€å§‹åæ­£å¼ä¸Šçº¿ã€‚ StoneAeon ä¸Šçº¿åï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬ä¼šä¸æ–­å®Œå–„æ¸¸æˆå¹¶å‘å¸ƒå‡çº§ï¼Œè¿™æ˜¯æ”¯æ’‘æ¸¸æˆé•¿æœŸè¿è¥çš„åŸºçŸ³ã€‚ åŒæ—¶ï¼Œè¿˜å°†å¯åŠ¨ç¤¾åŒºæ²»ç†ï¼Œé¼“åŠ±æ‰€æœ‰ SANFT æŒæœ‰è€…å’Œç¤¾åŒºç”¨æˆ·å‚ä¸ StoneAeon æœªæ¥çš„è¿­ä»£å’Œç©æ³•è®¾è®¡ï¼Œä»è€Œæ‰“é€ çœŸæ­£çš„ç¤¾åŒºè‡ªæ²»æ¸¸æˆã€‚ æˆ‘ä»¬ä¹Ÿæ¬¢è¿æ›´å¤šçš„åŠ å¯†ç”¨æˆ·æ¥åˆ° StoneAeon çš„ä¸–ç•Œã€‚

 
 

**Q9. Does the game have plans for multiple chains? Will the game update other gameplay modes?**

**æ¸¸æˆæ˜¯å¦æœ‰å¤šé“¾ä¸Šçº¿çš„è®¡åˆ’ï¼Ÿæ¸¸æˆä¼šæ›´æ–°å…¶ä»–æ¸¸æˆæ¨¡å¼å—ï¼Ÿ**

 
 

Aï¼šRight now, product development is our No.1 priority

To us, PlatON is an enabling ecosystem in terms of community and support. In this great ecosystem, we can keep on improving our game without worrying about anything else.

Speaking of new plans, we are developing a PVP system, which will also be a milestone for StoneAeon.

After users become stronger via staking in the early stage of the game, the demand for more competition will definitely go up, which is a stage that all games have to go through.

Of course, in terms of the entire gaming ecosystem, we prefer being regarded as part of the StoneAeon community.

When the game remains in its infancy, we will be there to guide the development of gameplays, build the basic framework, and design the core system.

As the game matures, community governance will kick in, and users will be able to get deeply involved in the design of StoneAeon via governance. We envision a future when all users will become owners of StoneAeon.

title: Value Locked in Defi Slips to $74 Billion, Top Smart Contract Tokens Down Over 70% This Year
body:
![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/defibears.jpg)

**Decentralized finance (defi) has been hit hard by the recent crypto market rout as the total value locked (TVL) across 118 different blockchains has slipped below the $100 billion mark to todayâ€™s $74.27 billion. The TVL in defi today is down more than 70% from its December 2, 2021, all-time high (ATH) at $253.91 billion. Moreover, since December 2021, the top smart contract platform tokens have lost 70% in value against the U.S. dollar as well, sliding from $823 billion to todayâ€™s $245 billion.**

## Defi Continues to Get Slammed by the Market Carnage, Top Smart Contract Platform Tokens Record Significant Losses

While a great number of cryptocurrencies including the leading crypto asset in terms of market valuation, bitcoin ([BTC](https://markets.bitcoin.com/crypto/BTC)), slid significantly in value, smart contract platform tokens and decentralized finance (defi), in general, suffered a great deal.

While [Terraâ€™s LUNA and UST fallout](https://news.bitcoin.com/a-dark-day-for-crypto-a-deep-dive-into-the-obliterated-terra-token-ecosystem-and-damaged-apps/) primed the flames, [issues with Celsius](https://news.bitcoin.com/report-celsius-hires-citigroup-to-help-the-startup-find-potential-financing/), [Three Arrows Capital (3AC)](https://news.bitcoin.com/report-bitmex-deribit-liquidate-3acs-positions-negativity-continues-to-plague-the-crypto-hedge-fund/), and the lack of trust in algorithmic stablecoins have continued to keep defi fires roaring. Six days ago, Bitcoin.com [reported](https://news.bitcoin.com/defi-platforms-and-smart-contract-tokens-suffer-the-most-during-the-crypto-market-rout/) on how defi and smart contract coins got slammed by significant blows and at the time, there was still $104 billion in value locked into a myriad of defi protocols.

Today, the total value locked (TVL) in defi is [$74.27 billion](https://defillama.com/), down 70.74% since the all-time high 197 days ago on December 2, 2021. The defi protocol Makerdao dominates the pack with 10.43% in terms of the applicationâ€™s TVL of $7.75 billion out of the $74.27 billion.

![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/dddata.jpg)

During the past 24 hours, the entire TVL across 118 different blockchain networks dropped by 6.03%. Makerdaoâ€™s TVL shed 15.19% during the past seven days and the second-largest protocol in terms of TVL size Aave lost over 40% last week.

Today, ethereum commands the [largest TVL](https://defillama.com/chains) size out of all the blockchains with $47.33 billion or 64.18% of the aggregate locked. The second-largest defi blockchain as far as TVL size is concerned is Binance Smart Chain (BSC) with $6.06 billion or 8.22% of the $74.27 billion locked in defi today.

![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/ddsundgdjkk.jpg)

Tron is the third-largest blockchain network in terms of TVL size with 3.99 billion or 5.42% of the aggregate locked across the 118 chains. Furthermore, the total value locked in cross-chain bridges from Ethereum has dropped more than 60% during the past month, according to Dune Analytics [metrics](https://dune.com/eliasimos/Bridge-Away-(from-Ethereum)).

![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/78863663.jpg)

The tokens often leveraged in defi, smart contract platform coins have also shed more than 70% since December. At that time, the market capitalization of all the smart contract platform tokens was [$823 billion](https://web.archive.org/web/20211223221620/https://www.coingecko.com/en/categories/smart-contract-platform) and today it is hovering just above [$245 billion](https://www.coingecko.com/en/categories/smart-contract-platform).

Ethereum ([ETH](https://markets.bitcoin.com/crypto/ETH)) is the leading smart contract platform token as it commands $131.50 billion of the $245 billion. [ETH](https://markets.bitcoin.com/crypto/ETH) is down 39.3% over the last seven days and most smart contract tokens have seen considerable losses during the past week.

Avalanche (AVAX) shed 34%, binance coin ([BNB](https://markets.bitcoin.com/crypto/BNB)) lost 25%, cardano ([ADA](https://markets.bitcoin.com/crypto/ADA)) dropped by 22.5%, polkadot (DOT) slid by 20.7%, and solana (SOL) lost 22.3% in seven days. One of the only smart contract coins not down this past week is chia (XCH) as it is up by 1.2% against the U.S. dollar.

title: SEC, State Regulators Probe Crypto Lender Celsius Over Accounts Freeze
body:
![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/sec-1.jpg)

**The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and several state regulators are reportedly investigating the decision by crypto lender Celsius Network to freeze withdrawals.**

## U.S. Securities Regulators Investigate Celsiusâ€™ Withdrawal Freeze

The U.S. SEC and securities regulators in Alabama, Kentucky, New Jersey, Texas, and Washington are investigating the decision by crypto lender Celsius Network to freeze withdrawals, Reuters reported Thursday.

Texasâ€™ director of enforcement Joseph Rotunda explained that officials representing the five state securities regulators met Monday morning to begin the investigation following Celsiusâ€™ withdrawal freeze announcement Sunday night.

Noting that the investigation is a â€œpriority,â€ Rotunda said:

> *I am very concerned that clients â€“ including many retail investors â€“ may need to immediately access their assets yet are unable to withdraw from their accounts.*

â€œThe inability to access their investment may result in significant financial consequences,â€ he stressed.

Rotunda said he and his team learned about Celsiusâ€™ accounts freeze from the companyâ€™s tweet and blog post Sunday night.

â€œDue to extreme market conditions, today we are announcing that Celsius is pausing all withdrawals, swaps, and transfers between accounts,â€ the company [wrote](https://news.bitcoin.com/celsius-insolvency-rumors-swirl-after-company-pauses-withdrawals-nexo-offers-to-buy-firms-assets/).

Alabama Securities Commission Director Joseph Borg told the publication that the SEC has also been in communication with Celsius, adding that the crypto lender has been responsive to questions from the regulators.

Last year, regulators in a number of states, including Alabama, Kentucky, New Jersey, and Texas hit Celsius with a cease and desist order over the lenderâ€™s interest-bearing products, which they said should be registered as a security.

After freezing withdrawals, Celsius reportedly [sought help from](https://news.bitcoin.com/report-celsius-seeks-help-from-restructuring-lawyers-over-financial-hardship/) Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld, a law firm that specializes in financial restructuring. The crypto lender is also reportedly [hiring Citigroup](https://news.bitcoin.com/report-celsius-hires-citigroup-to-help-the-startup-find-potential-financing/) as an advisor.

Moreover, Ben Armstrong, aka Bit Boy, announced a class-action lawsuit against Celsius and CEO Alex Mashinsky on Wednesday via Twitter.

title: NFT (Non-fungible token)
body:
**NFT (non-fungible token)**, also a unique token, is a type of cryptographic tokens, each instance of which is unique and cannot be exchanged or replaced by another similar token.
It is a kind of certificate of uniqueness and uniqueness of a digital object.

With the help of NFT technology, you can sell or buy any digital object â€“ music, image, 3D model, text, game item, etc. Its essence consists in registering a certain ownership right to a specific virtual object in the blockchain. Owner information cannot be replaced or deleted.

title: Kenyan Law Enforcement Agency Arrests Two Students Accused of Using Stolen Funds to Buy BTC
body:
![](https://static.news.bitcoin.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/shutterstock_1065517451.jpg)

**Two Kenyan students accused of hacking credit cards and using the ill-gotten funds to buy bitcoin have been arrested by the Directorate of Criminal Investigations, a statement from the law enforcement agency has said. After converting the cryptocurrency to local currency, the two students would use the fraudulently acquired funds to sustain their lavish lifestyle.**

## The Studentsâ€™ Lavish Lifestyle

A Kenyan law enforcement agency, the Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) said it has arrested two university students it accuses of hacking credit cards and using these to â€œpurchase bitcoins and convert them to Kenyan currency.â€ In a statement, the agency said the so-called notorious gang of two was nabbed in Milimani, an affluent neighborhood in Kenyaâ€™s fourth-largest city, Nakuru.

In a Twitter [thread](https://twitter.com/DCI_Kenya/status/1537303766277492738) explaining how the offense was carried out, the DCI revealed that the two â€” Francis Maina Wambui aka Nick, 26, and Zellic Alusa, 25 â€” had resorted to a growing criminal practice. The agency explained:

> *The students create fake email accounts which they use to hack credit cards of innocent persons, especially those living in foreign countries and use them to buy bitcoins.*

According to the DCI, the two students would then use the stolen funds to sustain their lavish lifestyle. The students also reportedly used the stolen money to entertain women and buy properties. Following the raid on an apartment where the duo was operating, the DCI said among the documents recovered was â€œa land sale agreement entered on May, 25, for a property valued at Sh 850,000 \[$7,240\] in Juja.â€

The statement added that the other items which were recovered include five laptops, four mobile phones, two wifi gadgets, three hard drives, and SIM cards.

Meanwhile, the DCIâ€™s announcement of the arrest has come just a few days after Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta[ called](https://twitter.com/NPSOfficial_KE/status/1536373480614252544) for the â€œstrengthening of the Cyber and Digital forensic lab to deal with contemporary crimes that involve misuse of technology.â€

The announcement of the arrests also came after local media reports warned that Kenyans may have lost funds to another crypto Ponzi outfit.

**[2. Posted on March 14](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/z7MbzjaQp6wk8HNJUYIKqD-BkCFB8o-maGjzegK9AhM)**

**[3. Posted on March 14 (second post)](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/fzX5SbE0BfN6wN80AUn9ZpNkqITuVZ_gNA4JJHaNAJg)**

**[7. Posted on March 17 (second post)](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/i7zIwsnFBkgmYgonSV7T8AoeEcpmN5G0ACAnm_yCPCQ)**

**[8. Posted on March 17 (third post)](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/EjPgVZewGeoFVA6Gv4W420oq4c9NDKAAm_63ema2Q-0)**

## Posted on March 19

I met with Le 25, or "Leah", at this quiet little steakhouse soaked in dim light. Her protruding ears framed her elongated but pretty face. Her makeup looked like it was applied by a six year old girl. She wore a blazer over a cocktail dressâ€”an outfit I had once seen on a character in a nineties sitcom. But despite her contrived attempts at fashion, I found her attractive. There was a tenderness about her frail, petite body and long arching neck, and I imagined there was a natural beauty under all the gook and tacky clothes.

I chewed the final bite of my steak and looked over to her. She looked down at her plate, hardly having touched it at all.

"How's your food?"

Her gaze was blank, as if staring through me. She had not looked directly into my eyes all night, which comforted me in a way. Her nervousness made me feel like I was in control. "Yes?" she squeaked.

"How do you like it?" I looked at her plate.

"It's...it's fine," she poked at her fish with her fork. Leah was cuter in person than on her profile. Le 25 seemed dull in her profile, nothing original, but Leah was very strange and fidgety.

â€œDid you know the singer Mitch Lucker tweeted â€˜*the dead are living*â€™ right before he died in a motorcycle accident?â€ I said.

â€œNoâ€¦I didnâ€™t...know,â€ she stammered, shaking her head. A gold crucifix hung from a chain on her neck.

â€œI like your necklace.â€

â€œThank you.â€

â€œAre you religious?â€

â€œVery.â€

â€œYou know, youâ€™re the second religious person I met this week? Christian, too.â€

â€œThatâ€™s a divineâ€¦sign. Donâ€™t youâ€¦think?â€ she stammered again.

A server passed us cradling a bottle of wine.

"Would you like wine or anything?"

"I can't. I'm on...on medication."

"Really?" My head perked up slightly.

"Generalized anxiety," she said.

"Oh no," I said. She nodded, grateful for my concern. "When did it start?"

"I was twenty one," she said. "Just a few...few years ago."

"Do you mind talking about it?" I said. Her eyes softened.

"Not atâ€¦all," she said, concentrating. "I had a panic attack thatâ€¦kept on going. Maybe it was because I...I just graduated university and was thrown into a high pressure job. Maybe...maybe it was a chemical imbalance. I have a psychiatrist, but he doesn't know. I thought...the medicine was just going to cure me instantly. Make it goâ€¦away. But they don't work that way."

I breathed deeper, and a strange but pleasant tingling feeling simmered in my chestâ€”something I've never felt before.

"Do...do you have experience with this sort of thing?" she said.

"With medication? No, never," I said.

"You'reâ€¦lucky," Leah visibly relaxed.

"So, what happened after?" I said.

"I had to resign from my job. That was...years ago. I went on workers comp for more than a year until I got this low stress job I have now. I can't even..."

A server interrupted her. "Do you want to take that home?" He motioned to her plate.

"What? Oh, no...no thank you," she said, looking at my eyes for the first time.

"Please, I'll take it," I said to the server.

"Would you like any coffee or dessert?" the server said.

"I'd like some dessert. What do you think, Leah? Want to share a piece of cake?"

Leah smiled.

Outside the restaurant I studied Leah touching her hair.

"You're taking the Dupont subway?" I asked. She nodded. "Let's go, I'll walk you."

Strolling down the narrow sidewalk, I cleared my throat, thinking of what to say, but as my lips parted, my mind drew a blank. Our hands accidentally touched and she flinched. We walked, neither of us talking.

Our hands touched again, and an instinct moved me to reach out and take hold of hers, but I stopped myself. I threw a sideways glance, and saw her looking down at her feet. I should hold her hand, I repeated to myself. But something was stopping me.

The attraction that stirred in my gut was real, but so was the fear of her pulling away. We walked the next few blocks in silence. I hesitated to look at her, but when I did, I saw her arms crossed over her chest, and I wondered what she was feeling. Online, when catfishing, rejections were meaningless, they were never rejecting me, but a fictional identity.

We arrived at the station. "Thanks for...the dinner. Sorry I didn't finish it," she said.

"No problem. I'll be having a good breakfast tomorrow," I lifted the plastic bag hanging in my hand.

"Where are youâ€¦heading after this?" she said.

"Queen West."

"Gosh, that's so close to where we came from. You...you didn't have to walk me."

"It's no problem," I peered down the street.

"Okay then," our eyes connected. A thought entered my mind like a moment in a movieâ€”that I should kiss herâ€”and I wanted to kiss her. But instead, I reached my arms around her for a hug.

She hugged me lightly, barely touching me, as if I was a formation of ash in danger of crumbling.

"Bye," I whispered. I thought I heard her say bye, too, but I wasn't certain.

I turned and walked back in the direction we came from, defeated, my palms moist. I focused on the emptiness ahead, and it welcomed me.


---

Continued on **Posted on March 20** dropping next noon.

## Posted on March 17 (third post)

The night club was packed. Strangers pressed against each other, trying to walk through the crowd. Rays of colored lights from the ceiling cut through the dry ice smoke and sweat-damp air.

"The trick is to look for a pairâ€”like us," said William, leaning against the bar. The bartender, showing off cleavage, brought us two open bottles of Stella and two shots of something yellowish. "Go, take it," said William.

I raised the shot glass up to my noseâ€”it was cheap tequila. I gulped it down and the burning in my throat faded to warmth in my stomach.

"Cheers," said William. We clinked our beer bottles and scanned the crowd.

Two women approached us, a blonde and a brunette, both of them glancing at William. They both looked slightly too old to be in the club, but still attractive in their tight outfits.

"Hey, what's your names?" William yelled over the loud dance music.

"Bailey," the blonde shook William's hand. "This is Jessica." She pointed at her friend.

"Have a shot with us," said William.

William flagged down the bartender and ordered something. Jessica caught me checking her out.

"So what do you girls do?" said William.

"We're both nurses."

"I heard all nurses are good in bed, is that true?"

I was embarrassed for a split second until the girls laughed.

"I'm an actor," he said. "Heâ€™s my manager," William pointed at me.

"Cool," they said in unison, nodding with approval.

The shots came, and we each toasted our little glasses.

"You know, you're as cute as a cupcake," William said as he grabbed Bailey by the hand and pulled her onto the dance floor. Jessica looked away and played with her hair.

"You're cute, for a short girl," I said, turning into the cocky jerk personality that I used for one of my fake Instagram profiles.

"You don't like short girls?" she twirled a strand of hair with her finger.

"Listen, let's have another shot, something light," I waved down the bartender.

"I don't usually drink this much," she said.

"You'll like this shot," I said. The bartender put her hand on my forearm. "Two lemon drops, please," I said.

I saw William by a speaker on the dance floor, making out with Bailey.

"Hey, look," I nudged Jessica.

She squinted into the crowd then laughed. "Slut!"

The shots came and we drank them quickly. She let out a cuteÂ woohooÂ after slamming the shot glass on the bar.

"Come," I dragged her to the dance floor. As we moved through the crowd, I looked back and saw her smiling, and I felt comfortable. I stopped and faced her. We stood in a sort of slow dance, swaying side to side. Reggaeton blasted through the crowd and one drunken guy kept bumping into me. We teased each other with our eyes, and I felt a strange excitement that I've never felt in my life. My hand ran down her back and settled just above her ass. I smelled mint gum mixed with alcohol on her breath, and pleasure rubbed over me like lotion.


---

After last call, the hordes of rowdy drunk people from nearby clubs and bars clambered into the Chinese restaurant. William and Bailey were lost in their own little world across the table from me and Jessica. William's arm stretched over the back of Bailey's chair and he whispered something into her ear. White plastic sheets covered the tables and the smell of grease and garlic mingled in the air among yells and drunken chatter.

Some douche bag from the next table started talking to Jessica, as if I wasn't even thereâ€”as if I was nothingâ€”as if I wouldn't, or couldn't, crush his face into my knuckles and watch him bleed onto his chicken fried rice.

"Turn the fuck around," I said. These were William's words coming out of my mouth.

"Huh?" he said. I glared at him.

"Bailey?" Jessica said, looking at Bailey with wide eyes asking for help.

"What you doing with this simp?" the douche bag said to Jessica.

I stood up as if my legs were commanding my body, and my anger commanded my legs. He stood up, too. He was a good inch or two taller than me.

"Yo, easy, he's drunk," said his friend who put his arm between us.

"Fuck you!" William threw an empty glass at his friendâ€”it hit him in the chest but didn't break.

Suddenly, I felt a burning pain in my lip and fell backwards, pushing our table back and dropping ass-first onto the floor. All of the douche bag's friends jumped up, and William swung his chair at them in wide arcs. One of them grabbed the chair and William backed up against a fish tank full of lobsters.

"Come on!" yelled William as the team of douche bags pounced on him. William fell to the ground and curled up into a ball as they stomped down on his back.

I tried to stand but was kicked back down. The screams from servers in Cantonese accents intensified. "Stop!" one yelled.

I picked up a fork from the ground and jabbed it towards the douche bag's leg. He jolted back and I sprung to my feet. The servers and some bystanders broke up the fight, and I picked up William. I pushed him out of the restaurant as a server yelled, "You leave now!"

Outside, a streetcar rumbled by and I heard William laughing beside me. He didn't even look like he had been in a fight. There were no marks on his face or blood on his clothes. He strutted down the sidewalk ahead of me. I double stepped to catch up with him. William seemed in a hurryâ€”not to leave, but to move onto something else. He didn't stop laughing, which made me laugh.

"Stop," I grabbed his shoulder. We jumped under the awning of a closed herbal store and caught our breaths. My bottom lip was pulsing. I pressed my finger on it to check for blood but there was none.

"Where's the girls?" said William.

"I don't know. I didn't see them when we left."

"They're not out here," William looked around while rubbing his ribs with a grimace. "Ah, fuck 'em."

Looking at William, rubbing his side and grinning like a mad man, I thought about how I never met anyone like him. It was intoxicating just to be around him.

We both lit a smoke and stood by the curb. Our Uber arrived sooner than expected, and we threw our smokes away after only a couple of drags. For the entire ride, William and I didn't say a word. We each stared out our windows to watch the city sidewalks whiz by. I studied the fumbling, drunk idiots walking downtown in early hours. A twenty-something guy sits on the curb with his head between his knees, his buddy patting his back. Two girls held up another girl between themâ€”her skirt folded up, revealing her blue thong. A forth friend following from behind attempted to fix it. I smelled the alcohol on my breath, perfume on my clothes, felt the pulsing in my lip, and I felt alive.

I opened Tinder to reply to Le 25. I wrote: *Dinner it is. Which day is good for you?*


---

Continued on **[Posted on March 19](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/xu3p5ZDgaB09ih_MACDN5aMLSA_JkgphKRAmLkmezdQ)**

title: What to learn from PieceOfShit, the king of marketing
body:
We are only at the very start of the Web3 revolution, Are you ready for the rest? Letâ€™s change this shitty space. 2 Burned Poops = 1 Shit Beast + 10 billion SHIT token

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/P9JYSfAPOmRyrNXHT0LHU.jpeg?height=1926&width=3367)

**ill poop it nft**

[https://opensea.io/collection/pieceofshit-wtf](https://opensea.io/collection/pieceofshit-wtf)

The first collection, "ill poop it nft" is a relatively simple collection: 10,000 NFTs featuring a fetid pile of shit surrounded by grimy drawings of vermin, flying craft, and decaying signs.

**ShitBeast**

[https://opensea.io/collection/shitbeast](https://opensea.io/collection/shitbeast)

PieceOfShitDeployer, seemingly unsatisfied with his ill poop it NFTs, launched another collection of shit NFTs titled â€œShitBeastâ€ featuring beasts smeared in. as theyâ€™re covered in shit. The total cap Shit Beast NFTs is 10k, 3905 for Genesis Shit Beasts, and 6095 for regular Shit Beasts. regular Shit Beasts users can mint directly on the official website Price is 0.06 ETH. burned poop NFTs for a Genesis Shit Beast NFT will be airdropped with a bathroom cleaner NFT that can upgrade your NFT into â€œPhase 3.â€

**ShitPlunger**

[https://opensea.io/collection/shitplunger](https://opensea.io/collection/shitplunger)

Total 8888 \*\*\*\*ShitPlunger, The airdrop ofÂ 3 ShitPlunger NFT for â€œill poop it nftâ€ hoder, noticed that there is still45 dumb ass who purchased the shitty plunger at a high price, They decided to fully refund these shit heads.

**Pixelverse Poops**

[https://opensea.io/collection/pixelverse-poops](https://opensea.io/collection/pixelverse-poops)

Poops to be pixelated? Why the fuck not? And they are cute as shit, right?

This series of NFT evolved gradually from Shit-ShitBeast-ShitMan.

it represents a â€œrevolutionâ€ in the NFT space. Look at the charts of similar projects, you know in your heart how this story ends.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x2PoRgv5nHzc280FQGMrb.jpeg?height=1080&width=1920)

body:
**[0. Everyone and No One](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/hJlbret7s1UixhnXGNrg2vtqSVnIaavjs70J7MCy3xI)**

**[1. Posted on March 13](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/6ZTDmM8M3ZCzCNdnQjC5StCItJqknCVFAxhXpVs-ZwI)**

**[6. Posted on March 17](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/k_eXh77hJ1Dzx9rfKvRu5niVUSNaKW0d_yk-3S9C9qc)**

**[7. Posted on March 17 (second post)](https://mirror.xyz/everyoneandnoone.eth/i7zIwsnFBkgmYgonSV7T8AoeEcpmN5G0ACAnm_yCPCQ)**

## Posted on March 17 (third post)

The night club was packed. Strangers pressed against each other, trying to walk through the crowd. Rays of colored lights from the ceiling cut through the dry ice smoke and sweat-damp air.

"The trick is to look for a pairâ€”like us," said William, leaning against the bar. The bartender, showing off cleavage, brought us two open bottles of Stella and two shots of something yellowish. "Go, take it," said William.

I raised the shot glass up to my noseâ€”it was cheap tequila. I gulped it down and the burning in my throat faded to warmth in my stomach.

"Cheers," said William. We clinked our beer bottles and scanned the crowd.

Two women approached us, a blonde and a brunette, both of them glancing at William. They both looked slightly too old to be in the club, but still attractive in their tight outfits.

"Hey, what's your names?" William yelled over the loud dance music.

"Bailey," the blonde shook William's hand. "This is Jessica." She pointed at her friend.

"Have a shot with us," said William.

William flagged down the bartender and ordered something. Jessica caught me checking her out.

"So what do you girls do?" said William.

"We're both nurses."

"I heard all nurses are good in bed, is that true?"

I was embarrassed for a split second until the girls laughed.

"I'm an actor," he said. "Heâ€™s my manager," William pointed at me.

"Cool," they said in unison, nodding with approval.

The shots came, and we each toasted our little glasses.

"You know, you're as cute as a cupcake," William said as he grabbed Bailey by the hand and pulled her onto the dance floor. Jessica looked away and played with her hair.

"You're cute, for a short girl," I said, turning into the cocky jerk personality that I used for one of my fake Instagram profiles.

"You don't like short girls?" she twirled a strand of hair with her finger.

"Listen, let's have another shot, something light," I waved down the bartender.

"I don't usually drink this much," she said.

"You'll like this shot," I said. The bartender put her hand on my forearm. "Two lemon drops, please," I said.

I saw William by a speaker on the dance floor, making out with Bailey.

"Hey, look," I nudged Jessica.

She squinted into the crowd then laughed. "Slut!"

The shots came and we drank them quickly. She let out a cuteÂ woohooÂ after slamming the shot glass on the bar.

"Come," I dragged her to the dance floor. As we moved through the crowd, I looked back and saw her smiling, and I felt comfortable. I stopped and faced her. We stood in a sort of slow dance, swaying side to side. Reggaeton blasted through the crowd and one drunken guy kept bumping into me. We teased each other with our eyes, and I felt a strange excitement that I've never felt in my life. My hand ran down her back and settled just above her ass. I smelled mint gum mixed with alcohol on her breath, and pleasure rubbed over me like lotion.


---

After last call, the hordes of rowdy drunk people from nearby clubs and bars clambered into the Chinese restaurant. William and Bailey were lost in their own little world across the table from me and Jessica. William's arm stretched over the back of Bailey's chair and he whispered something into her ear. White plastic sheets covered the tables and the smell of grease and garlic mingled in the air among yells and drunken chatter.

Some douche bag from the next table started talking to Jessica, as if I wasn't even thereâ€”as if I was nothingâ€”as if I wouldn't, or couldn't, crush his face into my knuckles and watch him bleed onto his chicken fried rice.

"Turn the fuck around," I said. These were William's words coming out of my mouth.

"Huh?" he said. I glared at him.

"Bailey?" Jessica said, looking at Bailey with wide eyes asking for help.

"What you doing with this simp?" the douche bag said to Jessica.

I stood up as if my legs were commanding my body, and my anger commanded my legs. He stood up, too. He was a good inch or two taller than me.

"Yo, easy, he's drunk," said his friend who put his arm between us.

"Fuck you!" William threw an empty glass at his friendâ€”it hit him in the chest but didn't break.

Suddenly, I felt a burning pain in my lip and fell backwards, pushing our table back and dropping ass-first onto the floor. All of the douche bag's friends jumped up, and William swung his chair at them in wide arcs. One of them grabbed the chair and William backed up against a fish tank full of lobsters.

"Come on!" yelled William as the team of douche bags pounced on him. William fell to the ground and curled up into a ball as they stomped down on his back.

I tried to stand but was kicked back down. The screams from servers in Cantonese accents intensified. "Stop!" one yelled.

I picked up a fork from the ground and jabbed it towards the douche bag's leg. He jolted back and I sprung to my feet. The servers and some bystanders broke up the fight, and I picked up William. I pushed him out of the restaurant as a server yelled, "You leave now!"

Outside, a streetcar rumbled by and I heard William laughing beside me. He didn't even look like he had been in a fight. There were no marks on his face or blood on his clothes. He strutted down the sidewalk ahead of me. I double stepped to catch up with him. William seemed in a hurryâ€”not to leave, but to move onto something else. He didn't stop laughing, which made me laugh.

"Stop," I grabbed his shoulder. We jumped under the awning of a closed herbal store and caught our breaths. My bottom lip was pulsing. I pressed my finger on it to check for blood but there was none.

"Where's the girls?" said William.

"I don't know. I didn't see them when we left."

"They're not out here," William looked around while rubbing his ribs with a grimace. "Ah, fuck 'em."

Looking at William, rubbing his side and grinning like a mad man, I thought about how I never met anyone like him. It was intoxicating just to be around him.

We both lit a smoke and stood by the curb. Our Uber arrived sooner than expected, and we threw our smokes away after only a couple of drags. For the entire ride, William and I didn't say a word. We each stared out our windows to watch the city sidewalks whiz by. I studied the fumbling, drunk idiots walking downtown in early hours. A twenty-something guy sits on the curb with his head between his knees, his buddy patting his back. Two girls held up another girl between themâ€”her skirt folded up, revealing her blue thong. A forth friend following from behind attempted to fix it. I smelled the alcohol on my breath, perfume on my clothes, felt the pulsing in my lip, and I felt alive.

I opened Tinder to reply to Le 25. I wrote: *Dinner it is. Which day is good for you?*


---

title: Wavpoint: the new wave of music curation
body:
*Written by: [@wavThe0ry](https://twitter.com/wavthe0ry)*

*TL;DR: Wavpoint is a new curation construct to collaboratively and transparently launch music/multimedia projects. Fans, collectors, other creatives will all have the opportunity to share ownership of each Wavpoint experience. Think [Mixcloud](https://www.mixcloud.com/) + [Boiler Room](https://boilerroom.tv/) + [listeningparty](https://leemartin.dev/how-to-throw-a-listening-party-for-your-song-album-or-podcast-67fac32d6c00) all wrapped in a web3 bow. â‹ˆ*

# ğŸ“€ A re-imagination of the playlist and content curation.

Playlists are cool. We used to dub mixtapes or burn CDs. Today much of our identities are intertwined in our streaming playlists. Itâ€™s profound how easy it is to consolidate our favorite songs and share those groupings with anyone. That said, we have lost something innate to art because of these advancements.

It feels necessary to advance more consciously this time around. We now have the power to provide more immersive curation. Streaming platforms, ironically, produce a sort of anti-connectivity between creator and fan. Media consumption has never been more transactional and, frankly, uninspiring. 8-tracks, LPs, cassettes and burnt CDs all provided some semblance of ownership and connectivity to the artist or curator. Itâ€™s a bummer not to have that connection. Well, cheer up!

[https://twitter.com/mikeybitcoin/status/1533280289316667392?s=20&t=ifhV-levXsJMBGt91hmZlA](https://twitter.com/mikeybitcoin/status/1533280289316667392?s=20&t=ifhV-levXsJMBGt91hmZlA)

> *Wavpoint is a new playlist and curation construct. By utilizing the power of web3 tech, the new wave of music curation will prove to strengthen the creator economy and the connection between creators and their fans.*

# ğŸ«  Wavpoint, a platform for curators, creators and fans.

The platform dynamics are pretty simple:

* Wavpoint will regularly release drops, hosted by a curator. Most of the time the curator will be a DJ, but can be a creator of any kind.
* Drops, more often than not, will consist of both music and visuals.
* Sometimes a drop will contain music created by the curator and/or a select few other creators. Other times a drop will also contain music that has been submitted to the curator by the general creative public.
* Curators can (and should) partner with graphic designers/filmmakers for the drop visuals. All drop contributors will be showcased and compensated accordingly. Collaboration. Fun.
* Each track in the set/track list will reveal itself in real-time as the track begins.
* **And â€“ you guessed it â€“ anyone will be able to mint an NFT edition during the duration of the drop.**
* Minting will only be possible during the course of the drop. Duration length will vary by drop. Supply will be unlimited during the drop duration.
* 1 rare edition will be hidden within the drop at a randomly generated timestamp. Whoever mints closest to this timestamp will receive the rare edition.
* Edition NFT price may vary, but will most likely default to 0.1 ETH.

ğŸ”® Wavpoint will be built on top of [Zoraâ€™s Drop Protocol](https://github.com/ourzora/zora-drops-contracts).

ğŸ¤ Co-hosts are an interesting concept and will help amplify a drop. A co-host will most likely be a brand, record label, DAO, another curator, or someone that some number of people think is cool. But again, a co-host can be anyone or anything.

ğŸª© Drops can be thought of as a community activator, a standalone piece of art, or both. Be creative. Make a film, or a film coupled with a live performance. Create a disruptive experience that announces your tour. Wavpoint is your oyster. **Collaborate and amplify.**

![Potential Wavpoint UI/UX Preview](https://media.giphy.com/media/cyyTcQ8qZIVJwSH3N7/giphy.gif)

# ğŸŒ Splits & Fees

All revenue generated from drop edition NFT sales will be distributed transparently between the curator, drop song artists, graphic artists, filmmakers, co-hosts and Wavpoint via the [0xSplits protocol](https://www.0xsplits.xyz/). Initially all percentage splits will most likely be fixed by contributor category. More details to come regarding this.

There will be a Wavpoint platform fee of 5% per transaction (primary and secondary). Fees will land in the Wavpoint treasury. They will be used to compensate core team members, pay for platform admin/storage costs and pay for development to advance the roadmap. As the platform stabilizes, we will definitely consider redistributing a portion of the platform fees back to the community.

# ğŸ— Ahh, yesâ€¦Utility?

As you might imagine, holding an NFT is essentially your golden ticket to access a number of different perks provided by all curators, creators and co-hosts involved in a given drop. In the platformâ€™s infancy, we will urge all creators to direct NFT holders to their respective token-gated websites/communities.[Tell.ie](https://join.tell.ie/), [Mintgate](https://www.mintgate.io/) and [Unlock Protocol](https://unlock-protocol.com/) are all providing amazing tools for artists to gate content and experiences.

Ultimately, Wavpoint will also provide a suite of tools for natively gating content and providing the ability to redeem tokens for IRL events/concert tickets. Sick.

Wavpoint will consistently be releasing new features. Drop NFT holders and Genesis Access Pass NFT holders will always be the first to participate in new partnerships and test new features.

# ğŸŸ Wavpoint Genesis Access Pass NFT

> Soon you will be able to mint an NFT that will be required to access the Genesis season of Wavpoint drops. ğŸš¨ **An announcement will be made on the [Wavpoint Discord](https://discord.gg/qk4WKnrZpd) the moment the NFT is added to this post and available to mint.** ğŸš¨

We are not yet sure how many drops the Genesis season will include, but as you might imagine, we want to reward Genesis supporters with exclusive access and the opportunity to provide critical early feedback.

There will be a limited number of passes available. Secondary market availability may also be limited given the utility the pass provides. Donâ€™t sleep.

![](https://64.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lrxfu4CfBI1qmpg90o1_500.gifv)

# ğŸŒ€ Closing Thoughts

Stay the curious course. Exploration of the new frontier of possibilities in tech have catalyzed a wave of previously undiscovered purpose. This phenomenon is increasing exponentially in the web3 thoughtspace (despite market volatility). We canâ€™t quite know what Wavpoint will become. It will probably evolve into a DAO, but not just for the sake of becoming a DAO. We are going to take it one step at a time and always put creator and community interest first.

In the meantime, we will do our best to announce details regarding the first drop (drop curator, submission period, drop date, etc.) in the coming weeks.

> We are also looking for like-minded collaborators to join the Wavpoint Core Team (creatives, devs, operatives, treasury specialists, etc). If youâ€™re interested, **[please fill out this form](https://form.typeform.com/to/g2fEk5PF)** and weâ€™ll reach out to you.

ğŸ¥‚Cheers.

title: Wavpoint: the new wave of music curation
body:
*Written by: [@wavThe0ry](https://twitter.com/wavthe0ry)*

*TL;DR: Wavpoint is a new curation construct to collaboratively and transparently launch music/multimedia projects. Fans, collectors, other creatives will all have the opportunity to share ownership of each Wavpoint experience. Think [Mixcloud](https://www.mixcloud.com/) + [Boiler Room](https://boilerroom.tv/) + [listeningparty](https://leemartin.dev/how-to-throw-a-listening-party-for-your-song-album-or-podcast-67fac32d6c00) all wrapped in a web3 bow. â‹ˆ*

# ğŸ“€ A re-imagination of the playlist and content curation.

Playlists are cool. We used to dub mixtapes or burn CDs. Today much of our identities are intertwined in our streaming playlists. Itâ€™s profound how easy it is to consolidate our favorite songs and share those groupings with anyone. That said, we have lost something innate to art because of these advancements.

It feels necessary to advance more consciously this time around. We now have the power to provide more immersive curation. Streaming platforms, ironically, produce a sort of anti-connectivity between creator and fan. Media consumption has never been more transactional and, frankly, uninspiring. 8-tracks, LPs, cassettes and burnt CDs all provided some semblance of ownership and connectivity to the artist or curator. Itâ€™s a bummer not to have that connection. Well, cheer up!

[https://twitter.com/mikeybitcoin/status/1533280289316667392?s=20&t=ifhV-levXsJMBGt91hmZlA](https://twitter.com/mikeybitcoin/status/1533280289316667392?s=20&t=ifhV-levXsJMBGt91hmZlA)

> *Wavpoint is a new playlist and curation construct. By utilizing the power of web3 tech, the new wave of music curation will prove to strengthen the creator economy and the connection between creators and their fans.*

# ğŸ«  Wavpoint, a platform for curators, creators and fans.

The platform dynamics are pretty simple:

* Wavpoint will regularly release drops, hosted by a curator. Most of the time the curator will be a DJ, but can be a creator of any kind.
* Drops, more often than not, will consist of both music and visuals.
* Sometimes a drop will contain music created by the curator and/or a select few other creators. Other times a drop will also contain music that has been submitted to the curator by the general creative public.
* Curators can (and should) partner with graphic designers/filmmakers for the drop visuals. All drop contributors will be showcased and compensated accordingly. Collaboration. Fun.
* Each track in the set/track list will reveal itself in real-time as the track begins.
* **And â€“ you guessed it â€“ anyone will be able to mint an NFT edition during the duration of the drop.**
* Minting will only be possible during the course of the drop. Duration length will vary by drop. Supply will be unlimited during the drop duration.
* 1 rare edition will be hidden within the drop at a randomly generated timestamp. Whoever mints closest to this timestamp will receive the rare edition.
* Edition NFT price may vary, but will most likely default to 0.1 ETH.

ğŸ”® Wavpoint will be built on top of [Zoraâ€™s Drop Protocol](https://github.com/ourzora/zora-drops-contracts).

ğŸ¤ Co-hosts are an interesting concept and will help amplify a drop. A co-host will most likely be a brand, record label, DAO, another curator, or someone that some number of people think is cool. But again, a co-host can be anyone or anything.

ğŸª© Drops can be thought of as a community activator, a standalone piece of art, or both. Be creative. Make a film, or a film coupled with a live performance. Create a disruptive experience that announces your tour. Wavpoint is your oyster. **Collaborate and amplify.**

![Potential Wavpoint UI/UX Preview](https://media.giphy.com/media/cyyTcQ8qZIVJwSH3N7/giphy.gif)

# ğŸŒ Splits & Fees

All revenue generated from drop edition NFT sales will be distributed transparently between the curator, drop song artists, graphic artists, filmmakers, co-hosts and Wavpoint via the [0xSplits protocol](https://www.0xsplits.xyz/). Initially all percentage splits will most likely be fixed by contributor category. More details to come regarding this.

There will be a Wavpoint platform fee of 5% per transaction (primary and secondary). Fees will land in the Wavpoint treasury. They will be used to compensate core team members, pay for platform admin/storage costs and pay for development to advance the roadmap. As the platform stabilizes, we will definitely consider redistributing a portion of the platform fees back to the community.

# ğŸ— Ahh, yesâ€¦Utility?

As you might imagine, holding an NFT is essentially your golden ticket to access a number of different perks provided by all curators, creators and co-hosts involved in a given drop. In the platformâ€™s infancy, we will urge all creators to direct NFT holders to their respective token-gated websites/communities.[Tell.ie](https://join.tell.ie/), [Mintgate](https://www.mintgate.io/) and [Unlock Protocol](https://unlock-protocol.com/) are all providing amazing tools for artists to gate content and experiences.

Ultimately, Wavpoint will also provide a suite of tools for natively gating content and providing the ability to redeem tokens for IRL events/concert tickets. Sick.

Wavpoint will consistently be releasing new features. Drop NFT holders and Genesis Access Pass NFT holders will always be the first to participate in new partnerships and test new features.

# ğŸŸ Wavpoint Genesis Access Pass NFT

> Soon you will be able to mint an NFT that will be required to access the Genesis season of Wavpoint drops. ğŸš¨ **An announcement will be made on the [Wavpoint Discord](https://discord.gg/qk4WKnrZpd) the moment the NFT is added to this post and available to mint.** ğŸš¨

We are not yet sure how many drops the Genesis season will include, but as you might imagine, we want to reward Genesis supporters with exclusive access and the opportunity to provide critical early feedback.

There will be a limited number of passes available. Secondary market availability may also be limited given the utility the pass provides. Donâ€™t sleep.

![](https://64.media.tumblr.com/tumblr_lrxfu4CfBI1qmpg90o1_500.gifv)

# ğŸŒ€ Closing Thoughts

Stay the curious course. Exploration of the new frontier of possibilities in tech have catalyzed a wave of previously undiscovered purpose. This phenomenon is increasing exponentially in the web3 thoughtspace (despite market volatility). We canâ€™t quite know what Wavpoint will become. It will probably evolve into a DAO, but not just for the sake of becoming a DAO. We are going to take it one step at a time and always put creator and community interest first.

In the meantime, we will do our best to announce details regarding the first drop (drop curator, submission period, drop date, etc.) in the coming weeks.

> We are also looking for like-minded collaborators to join the Wavpoint Core Team (creatives, devs, operatives, treasury specialists, etc). If youâ€™re interested, **[please fill out this form](https://form.typeform.com/to/g2fEk5PF)** and weâ€™ll reach out to you.

ğŸ¥‚Cheers.

Ğ¡ĞµĞ¹Ñ‡Ğ°Ñ Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚Ğ° Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ²ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ†Ğ¸Ğ¸, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾ĞºĞµĞ½ Ğ´Ğ¾ ÑĞ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞµÑ‚ Ğ¼ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ° Ğ±Ñ‹Ñ‚ÑŒ - Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¹Ğ½Ğµ ĞºÑ€Ğ°Ğ¹Ğ½Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞ·Ğ½Ğ¾, Ğ° Ñ‚ĞµĞ¼ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ĞµĞµ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²ÑƒÑ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ², ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğµ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ²ĞµÑ€Ñ‚Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑÑ Ğ·Ğ´ĞµÑÑŒ.

body:
ĞšĞ°Ğº Ğ½Ğ¸ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾, ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ»ĞµĞ¶Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ñ€Ğ°ÑÑĞ¼Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ€ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğµ, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ Ñƒ Ğ½ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‚ÑÑƒÑ‚ÑÑ‚Ğ²ÑƒĞµÑ‚ **Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½Ğ¾Ñ†ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑĞ¾Ğ±Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ¿Ğ¾ Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ñƒ**. ĞšĞ°Ğº Ğ±Ñ‹ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğµ Ğ·Ğ²ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾, Ğ½Ğ° ÑĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğµ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ Ğ²Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ»ÑŒ, Ğ¸Ğ±Ğ¾ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´ Ğ¼Ñ‹ ĞµÑ‰Ğµ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ Ñ ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ³Ğ¾ **[early Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒ](https://twitter.com/omniteonft/status/1519350494581465091?s=20&t=20OW4qaX_zDkBvF7lbYS6A)**, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ°Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ ÑÑƒĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ²ĞºÑƒÑĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ»ÑÑˆĞºĞ°Ğ¼Ğ¸

Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞ½ Ğ½Ğ° **[LayerZero](https://layerzero.network/)**, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ÑĞ¸Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ğ¾ Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¸Ñ‚ **[Ğ°16z](https://a16z.com/2022/03/30/investing-in-layerzero/)**, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ´ÑƒĞ¼Ğ°Ñ Ğ² Ğ±Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ¶Ğ°Ğ¹ÑˆĞµĞ¼ Ğ¼Ñ‹ ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ñ‚Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¶ĞµĞ¼ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´ĞµÑ‚ÑŒ. Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ²ÑĞµ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚Ñ‹ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¹ ÑĞ¸ÑÑ‚ĞµĞ¼Ğµ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ Ğ´ĞµĞ»Ğ°ÑÑ‚ **Ñ‚Ğ¸Ñ…Ğ¸Ğµ ÑĞ½Ğ°Ğ¿ÑˆĞ¾Ñ‚Ñ‹**, Ñ‡Ñ‚Ğ¾ ÑÑƒĞ»Ğ¸Ñ‚ Ğ±Ğ¾Ğ»ÑŒÑˆĞ¸Ğ¼ Ğ¾Ğ±ÑŠÑ‘Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ¼ĞµĞ½ÑŒÑˆĞµĞ¹ Ğ°ÑƒĞ´Ğ¸Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/4KkYV_mgyc8D6SOtEOdFj.png?height=500&width=1500)

title: Starbucksâ€™ North American head to leave the company as chain shakes up leadership
body:
![](https://image.cnbcfm.com/api/v1/image/107055289-1651599685970-gettyimages-1240396209-STARBUCKS_EARNS.jpeg?v=1651599726&w=740&h=416&ffmt=webp)

[Starbucksâ€™](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/SBUX) North American president Rossann Williams is leaving the company and will be replaced by the head of the coffee chainâ€™s Asia Pacific division.

The announcement Friday marks the latest change to the company under interim CEO Howard Schultz, who returned to the top job in April after the departure of former CEO Kevin Johnson. Schultz is slated to stick around in the role through around the end of the year, after the board names a long-term successor. In his time so far, Schultz has paused the companyâ€™s stock buyback program, committed $1 billion to raise wages and improve cafes and vocally pushed back against union efforts.

â€œAs we embark on the next chapter, we have made a difficult, but necessary change to our North America business; a change that creates new leadership for a new era at Starbucks,â€ John Culver, the companyâ€™s chief operating officer, wrote in a memo to employees viewed by CNBC. â€œThe decision was not taken lightly and was one preceded by discussion about a next opportunity for Rossann within the company, which she declined.â€

Williams has worked for Starbucks since 2004, when she joined the coffee chain after stints at Toys â€™R Us and Blockbuster. Over the last year, sheâ€™s been one of the public faces of the companyâ€™s efforts to curb unionization efforts by its baristas. More than 150 Starbucks cafes in the U.S. have voted to unionize, as of Friday.

The Wall Street Journal first reported Williamsâ€™s departure.

Sara Trilling, who currently serves as president of Starbucksâ€™ Asia Pacific business, will succeed Williams in the role, effective Tuesday. Trilling has been with the company for two decades, starting out in its creative studio working on its retail store design and working her way up. Williams will help with her transition through June and Cliff Burrows, president of the companyâ€™s Americas division, will also assist in an advisory role.

body:
Ğ—Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑƒÑ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ¶Ğ´Ğ°ÑÑ‚ Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾Ğµ ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² Ğ¸Ñ… Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ñ€Ğ¾Ğ²Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½ĞµĞ¹ ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¸, ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¸Ğ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¶Ğµ Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸ÑĞ¼Ğ¸ Ğ¼Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ±ÑŒĞµĞ¼ Ğ´Ğ²ÑƒÑ… Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¹Ñ†ĞµĞ² - ÑĞ¾Ğ·Ğ´Ğ°Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ°ĞºÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ²Ğ½Ğ¾ÑÑ‚ÑŒ Ğ² Cube Chain Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¼ĞµĞ¼ ÑƒÑ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚Ğ¸Ğµ Ğ² **[Zenith Beta Test Event](https://twitter.com/Zenith_Lending/status/1530752372833628165?s=20&t=NbnXVtlMvsmTGAANRgSbiw)**

Ğ¢Ğ°ĞºĞ¶Ğµ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ´Ñ‹ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ… Ğ¿Ñ‚Ğ°ÑˆĞµĞº, ĞµÑĞ»Ğ¸ ÑÑÑ‹Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚ÑŒÑÑ Ğ½Ğ° **[tokenomics](https://docs.zenith.finance/tokenomics/zenith-token)** Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ĞµĞºÑ‚Ğ° - Ğ¼Ñ‹ ÑƒĞ²Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼ ĞºĞ¾Ğ½ĞºÑ€ĞµÑ‚Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğµ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ñƒ ĞºĞ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ñ, Ğ½Ğ° Ğ½ĞµĞµ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ´ĞµĞ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¾ Ñ†ĞµĞ»Ñ‹Ñ… **1 500 000 $ZNT** (Ñ…Ğ¾Ñ‚Ñ Ğ½Ğ° ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ñ‚ **[Ğ¸Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ñ‚](https://docs.zenith.finance/announcement/betaevent)** Ğ²ÑĞµĞ³Ğ¾ 50 000 $ZNT)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/T256rIU_RC6lDIeIgQhvw.png?height=440&width=800)

## ĞŸÑ€ĞµĞ¶Ğ´Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ¼ Ğ¼Ñ‹ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ½ĞµĞ¼

ĞšĞ°Ğº Ğ¸ Ğ² Ğ»ÑĞ±Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğµ, Ğ²ÑÑ‘ Ğ½Ğ°Ñ‡Ğ¸Ğ½Ğ°ĞµÑ‚ÑÑ Ñ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ **ÑĞµÑ‚Ğ¸** Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»ÑƒÑ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ **Ñ‚ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ñ…** **Ğ¼Ğ¾Ğ½ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğº**, Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼Ñƒ Ğ¿Ñ€ĞµĞ´Ğ»Ğ°Ğ³Ğ°Ñ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµĞ¹Ñ‚Ğ¸ Ğ½Ğ° **[Chainlist](https://chainlist.org/)** Ğ¸ Ğ¿Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ² Ğ³Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¾Ñ‡ĞºÑƒ Ğ½Ğ° **Testnets** Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ¸Ñ‚ÑŒ ÑĞµĞ±Ğµ **Cube Chain Testnet**

![adding cube chain testnet to metamask](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/alwvMz8cq25iLzVnt_Kr-.png?height=1080&width=1920)

ĞŸĞ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ğ´Ğ¾Ğ±Ğ°Ğ²Ğ»ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğµ ÑĞµÑ‚Ğ¸, Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ½Ğ° [Cube Chain Test Faucet](https://faucet.cube.network/) Ğ¸ Ğ² ĞºĞ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ³Ğ¾Ñ€Ğ¸Ğ¸ **CUBE** Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ ÑÑ€ĞµĞ´ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ° Ğ½Ğ° ĞºĞ¾Ğ¼Ğ¸ÑÑĞ¸Ğ¸, Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ¾ Ğ²Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑĞ°Ğ² ÑĞ²Ğ¾Ğ¹ Ğ°Ğ´Ñ€ĞµÑ Ğ¸Ğ· Ğ¼ĞµÑ‚Ğ°Ğ¼Ğ°ÑĞºĞ°

![giving 0.5 CUBET for further steps](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a2E4JqeI68BWUpV8W5_vj.png?height=1080&width=1920)

ĞŸĞ¾ÑĞ»Ğµ Ñ‡ĞµĞ³Ğ¾ Ğ¿ĞµÑ€ĞµÑ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ² Ñ€Ğ°Ğ·Ğ´ĞµĞ» **CRC 20** Ğ¸ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ°ÑˆĞ¸Ğ²Ğ°ĞµĞ¼ **Wrapped BTC (WBTC)**, ĞºĞ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ñ€Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ½Ğ°Ğ¼ Ğ±ÑƒĞ´ĞµÑ‚ Ğ½ĞµĞ¾Ğ±Ñ…Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¼ Ğ´Ğ»Ñ Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ»Ğ½ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ñ Ğ´Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½ĞµĞ¹ÑˆĞ¸Ñ… Ğ´ĞµĞ¹ÑÑ‚Ğ²Ğ¸Ğ¹

title: Microsoft finds Gen Z is redefining the idea of work hustle in and outside the office
body:
![](https://image.cnbcfm.com/api/v1/image/107077601-1655480061650-gettyimages-917222832-180209_JBER_PHT004.jpeg?v=1655480101&w=740&h=416&ffmt=webp)

For decades Microsoft has been associated with a traditional definition of office work, long hours in front of a computer, but now the corporate enterprise giant finds Gen Z entrepreneurs disrupting ideas about workplace hustle and the traditional 9-5 day.Â Many recent Gen Z college graduates are flipping the career paradigm and pursuing entrepreneurship rather than entering the corporate world.Â 

â€œWeâ€™ve seen a lot of reimagination during the pandemic and a lot of digital transformation, which I think really has propelled what we see as a bit of a boom in entrepreneurship,â€ says Travis Walter, vice president of retail at Microsoft Store. [Almost two-thirds (62%) of Gen Z](https://wpengine.com/resources/gen-z-2020-full-report/#:\~:text=Generation%20Influence%3A%20Reaching%20Gen%20Z%20in%20the%20New%20Digital%20Paradigm,-Posted%20in%20Marketing&text=Throughout%20history%2C%20generations%20have%20been,forces%20that%20inform%20generational%20identity.) has indicated they have started, or intend to start, their own business, according to data from WP Engine and the Center for Generational Kinetics. Meanwhile, in 2021 alone, 5.4 million Americans submitted applications to start their own business, according to government data.Â Â 

The traditional idea of â€œhustle cultureâ€ has evolved over the years, and while the grind Gen Z puts in looks slightly different than millennials, it doesnâ€™t mean theyâ€™re doing any less work. Instead, these entrepreneurs wear multiple hats with flexible work schedules, working vacations and more consideration for personal time. Nearly half of Gen Z, about 48%, have numerous side hustles, compared to 34% of small business owners, according to [Microsoftâ€™s survey](https://blogs.windows.com/windowsexperience/2022/06/06/gen-trepreneur-z-is-making-its-mark-on-the-future-of-small-business/), conducted by Wakefield Research across 1,000 small business owners with less than 25 employees.Â Many of these businesses overlap with the rise in social media marketing. Entrepreneurs who use TikTok for their business (48%) are almost twice as likely to have multiple side hustles as those who do not (27%), according to the Microsoft data.

â€œI think itâ€™s important to let people work the way they need to work because then they can actually do their best work, as weâ€™re seeing with entrepreneurs and Gen Z,â€ Walter said.

Microsoftâ€™s data shows 91% of Gen Z entrepreneurs work unconventional hours; 81% say they work on vacation, compared to 62% of business owners overall.Â 

â€œWhat do I truly want to do?â€ is a question being asked more frequently, according to Philip Gaskin, vice president of entrepreneurship at the Ewing Marion Kauffman Foundation. â€œThatâ€™s some of that Gen Z energy,â€ he said.

Gen Z graduates are coming into the workforce during the pandemic period of â€œrediscovery,â€ Gaskin said, a reevaluation of personal and professional goals by many Americans across generations. Some people who may have been bored of their corporate jobs, or felt stale at a point in life, were given the time to pause and reevaluate. Many people who saw an opportunity went for it during the pandemic, often with new technology ideas. The boom in new business formation isnâ€™t uniformly a rosy scenario. In some cases, it is a function of necessity, according to Kauffmanâ€™s analysis, with people who lost their jobs needing new forms of income.

This shift is correlated with a rate of new entrepreneurs that has been growing for several years, with 2020 showing the highest spike of all, according to Kauffman Foundation data. And it has big implications for the labor market. â€œMost jobs created over the last five years were provided by firms less than five years old,â€ Gaskin said.

Gen-Z is also leaning more towards the entrepreneurship path rather than getting involved in corporate America right out of college because many see it as a way to fast-track their retirement. About 61% of Gen Z small business owners believe they will be able to retire faster than if they had gotten a corporate job, compared to 40% of all small business owners who hold this view, according to the Microsoft survey.Â Among the broader small business community, amassing retirement savings through investment vehicles has historically been a challenge and much of their income directly reinvested in the business, which has provided [reason for concern about financial security](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/06/05/behind-on-retirement-saving-a-bad-market-can-be-a-good-time-to-invest.html) among entrepreneurs.

## Mission-driven, problem-solving Gen Z entrepreneur

Ritwik Pavan, a Gen Z entrepreneur, has already started several businesses.

â€œIâ€™ve been on the entrepreneurial journey since high school, and I always wanted to build something because I always had the problem-solving type of mindset,â€ Pavan said.

The big idea he landed on after working in various tech niches, including app development, since college, is in urban mobility.

With co-founders Matthew Schaefer and Christian Burke, he launched Vade in 2018, which helps reduce traffic congestion and carbon emissions by providing real-time parking data for citizens.

![](https://image.cnbcfm.com/api/v1/image/107077596-1655479571268-vadecofounders.jpg?v=1655479692&w=740&h=416&ffmt=webp)

â€œIâ€™m helping all these people solve problems and build their ideas, but Iâ€™d love to go find something Iâ€™m passionate about solving and for me, that problem was parking,â€ Pavan said. â€œThe best part about being an entrepreneur is that weâ€™re very mission-driven and believe that what weâ€™re going to do is going to change lives for the better and help cities become better places to live,â€ he said.

According to the Microsoft survey, around 88% of all small business owners who prioritize social good say it helped their business grow, including 82% of Gen Z respondents.Â 

Pavan is an example of how work hustle has changed. His favorite part about being a small business owner is the flexibility that comes with the job, but that doesnâ€™t mean working fewer hours than a corporate boss like [Jamie Dimon](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/01/06/young-employees-are-losing-out-on-a-lot-by-not-going-to-the-office-business-experts-say.html) or [Elon Musk](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/06/01/elon-musk-reportedly-tells-tesla-workers-to-be-in-office-full-time-or-resign.html) demands.

â€œThe truth is, as a founder, for the first three years me and my co-workers were working 18-hour days, even 20 hour days, even now sometimes,â€ Pavan said.

But being able to make decisions for your own company, he says, makes the long hours worthwhile, even if that also means being responsible for the bad ones.Â According to the Microsoft data, many Gen Z entrepreneurs start this decision-making, like Pavan, before college, and many donâ€™t see a degree as being critical to their success: 78% of Gen Z entrepreneurs say a college education is â€œnot very necessaryâ€ for them to run a business.

title: SpaceX fires at least 5 employees over internal letter criticizing CEO Elon Musk
body:
![](https://image.cnbcfm.com/api/v1/image/106560040-1591023352303ksc-20200530-ph-kls04_0056_large.jpg?v=1591023406&w=740&h=416&ffmt=webp)

SpaceX has fired at least five employees who were involved with circulating a letter around the company that was critical of CEO [Elon Musk](https://www.cnbc.com/elon-musk/), according to two people familiar with the company who declined to be named and an internal email from President and COO Gwynne Shotwell.

Shotwell, in a companywide email Thursday, said SpaceX â€œterminated a number of employees involvedâ€ and called â€œblanketing thousands of people across the company with repeated unsolicited emailsâ€ unacceptable, according to copies of the email obtained by CNBC. The open letter, first reported by [The Verge](https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/16/23170228/spacex-elon-musk-internal-open-letter-behavior), was circulated earlier this week. More than 400 SpaceX employees signed the letter in just under a day and a half, [The Verge reported Friday](https://www.theverge.com/2022/6/17/23172913/spacex-complaint-letter-firing-elon-musk).

â€œWe have too much critical work to accomplish and no need for this kind of overreaching activism,â€ Shotwell wrote, adding the letter â€œupset manyâ€ within the company and â€œmade employees feel uncomfortable, intimidated and bullied.â€

The letter was addressed to company executives, according to media reports, and described the billionaireâ€™s public behavior as â€œa frequent source of distraction and embarrassmentâ€ for SpaceX employees.

[The New York Times](https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/17/technology/spacex-employees-fired-musk-letter.html) first reported the SpaceX firings. SpaceX did not immediately respond to CNBCâ€™s request for comment.

Musk is the controlling shareholder of the privately held company, with his trust owning about 78% of SpaceXâ€™s voting shares as of last year. The CEO has created an often eccentric persona in public spheres, particularly on [Twitter](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/TWTR) where he offers commentary and updates on SpaceX and his electric vehicle company, [Tesla](https://www.cnbc.com/quotes/TSLA).

Musk has said he uses Twitter to [express himself, comparing his use of the service to how â€œsome people use their hair](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/06/16/elon-musk-is-addressing-twitter-employees-live-updates-from-the-meeting.html),â€ and is seeking to acquire the social media company.

During a [Twitter all-hands meeting Thursday](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/06/16/elon-musk-is-addressing-twitter-employees-live-updates-from-the-meeting.html), Musk said free speech is critical to users of the platform â€“ even if a company is under his private ownership, like SpaceX.

The internal SpaceX letter also referenced recent sexual misconduct allegations against Musk, [reported by Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-paid-250000-to-a-flight-attendant-who-accused-elon-musk-of-sexual-misconduct-2022-5) last month. The report said that Musk sexually harassed a SpaceX flight attendant during a private flight, and that the company paid the employee $250,000 for her silence.

[Shotwell defended Musk after the misconduct allegations](https://www.cnbc.com/2022/05/23/spacex-president-gwynne-shotwell-defends-elon-musk-over-sex-misconduct-allegations.html), writing in an email to employees at the time that she believes â€œthe allegations to be false.â€

In her email Thursday, Shotwell said SpaceX leadership â€œis more dedicated to ensuring we have a great and ever-improving work environment than any I have seenâ€ in her career. She also emphasized SpaceX has a trio of launches scheduled â€œwithin 37 hoursâ€ this weekend, as well as ongoing work to support the International Space Station.

â€œI am sorry for this distraction,â€ Shotwell said. â€œPlease stay focused on the SpaceX mission, and use your time at work to do your best work.â€
