Feel free to peruse. This issue of â€˜gasâ€™ needs to be *assumed* as at the very least *contentious* for what follows.

**KANTIAN ANGELIC MIND**

A further paradox in the original NFT essay was that according to one of the most evolved theorists of crypto in its *philosophical* aspectsâ€”Nick Landâ€”the release triggered by digital money inside technological signatures and rationality is itself angelicist in mood.

In his *[Crypto-Current](https://etscrivner.github.io/cryptocurrent/)* text, Land writes:

> AI is thus positioned, implicitly, in the place of a Kantian angelic mind, liberated from the anthopomorphic proscription upon direct self-modification of its own cognitive processes.

In other words, though we may expect the achievements of crypto-intelligence to consist of release from theogenic tropes, some of those tropesâ€”specifically, angelicismâ€”are already the height of what any digital shift can achieve.

Pure money as achieved rationality is also pure angelicism. There is nothing to update beyond angelism as rationality itself. Angelicism is the unupdateable. We are already as artificially intelligent as we can be. It (angelicism) is it.

The implication for NFT production is as radical as it is superfluous. That is, it will beâ€”radicallyâ€”ignored.

And yet, the implication *cannot not be* named. It *cannot not be* iterated, just as NFTs *cannot not be* producedâ€”both momentums, if you like, are part of the same essentially entropic ass vibes of aesthetic â€˜historyâ€™ rn.

**THE IMPLICATION**

The implication can be stated in terms of poetic cognition. Paul de Man said that when you see beautiful poetry itâ€™s almost impossible to resist, and not your fault for going ahead and (not) doing so, but it doesnâ€™t mean beautiful poetry is not lethal.

The same can be said of the spread of NFTs, and their latest â€˜Miladyâ€™ manifestationâ€”the beauty, fun, and unsummarisability of this Neochibi trend may be pictured in the context of [a water cooler in Treblinka](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-nfts-not-now-the-return-of-post). It is itselfâ€”holocaustically, impossibly, glossilyâ€”*fun*.

This perhaps sounds like nothing (everything) but it is probably everything (nothing) that nobody wants to think. We are saying that this argument about the extinction-costs (see links above) of all art right now willâ€”by definitionâ€”be ignored.

The brain of history does not and cannot read this *as what it sees* more than anything else in 2021. *It* is addicted to *its* indifference. NFTs are the summation of an indifference to indifference (â€˜funâ€™) and little else.

![One translation: the suicidal ideology of digital tropes (shades) is no different to 20th century abstract art knitwear (Rothkoâ€™s suicide). But the images taken togetherÂ areâ€”even nowâ€”impossibly attractive. \[Open-eyedness. The endearingness of a naÃ¯ve financial set theory, etc. One can ofc multiplyÂ justifications.\]](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F2f9156d0-11f1-4b5a-9bd6-0f482a77f239_915x787.png)

Tom Cohenâ€”the only real *theorist* of extinctionâ€”calls this lethal implication the *literary character of climate change*. That is, instead of culture being the exception to industrial civilisationâ€™s extinction drive, it is the central motor. It is cultureâ€”and online culture especiallyâ€”that above all will soon have killed us all.

This connotes that all great art is nowâ€”intensely, and not just contingentlyâ€”more-than-lethal. Which is to say, *profoundly* pedantic. That is the angelicist position, if there is one. And it is what makes angelicism a claim on the nonpedantic zone (pending, lacking, time).

**MORE AND MORE NFTS**

In the first â€˜No More NFTSâ€™ essay there was *zero expectation* that there would be . . . no more NFTs. The opposite was the case:

> *It is as impossible to heckle this development as it is to embrace it* \[our emphasis\]. A *degree* of abstinence may, at this point, be the only form of deception thatâ€™s *almost* dignified. Art criticismâ€™s rage at Crypto Art is no less empty than the worst of the art itself: passive nostalgia as the flipside of necrotic decadence, ass beating Priapus who kills it as reply.

A *critique* of Milady cannot be offered because Milady, no less than Beepleâ€™s *Dick Milking Factory* (2021), is as erroneous as it is inevitable. The two sides cannot be separated out. Neochibiâ€™s is Priapusâ€™ secret flip.

Where Beepleâ€™s art was priapic and therefore risible, Miladyâ€™s incoming wave will be as if well defended and hard to object to because of its cuddly post-ironic just-chillin cuteness. How can anyone want to trample on a tiny fairy factory, however invisibly canny and candied?

**NFTS IN AUGUST 2021, OR, MILADY IN TREBLINKA**

To recap, towards the end of August 2021 the â€˜miladyâ€™ phenomenon which had been in trial-state for a while was launched by the approximate Network Spirituality and Remilia group. Milady is, simply, an avatar meme generator of supreme sweetness. Put like that, it sounds non-mysterious. Just some innocent Gremlins, this time without the tragic add-water fault.

The official description of Milady Maker is of â€˜a collection of 10,000 generative pfp NFTs in a neochibi aesthetic inspired by street style tribesâ€™.[3](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-milady-nfts-not-now-the-return#footnote-3)

At one level, these image-contracts are obviously the inheritance of [the Miya Siyuan Zhao pfp proliferation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY) that peaked between 2019 and 2020, but this time hooked up to what is ultimately already an obsolescent NFT technology. Last time, it was â€˜Kaliaccâ€™ that felt prohibitive next to the images, this time itâ€™s â€˜gas pricesâ€™. The confusion is itself the ideological selling point.

Throughout 2021 Network Spirituality loosely positioned itself as anti-paywall (when it came to Substack) and anti-deadnaming (when it came to avatars), but it has also developed an increasing nonhomogenous interest in NFT technology, now flourishing as the pfpNFT Generator whose results have already been adopted casually by e.g. Mat Dryhurst, a figure in mainstream crypto â€˜interdependenceâ€™ theorisation and so on.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ku5sYvJJpi0Wn0f3-97F3.png?height=288&width=876)

One may of course ask questions of how an anti-paywall ethos fits with the use of NFTs, but thatâ€™s not necessarily the most interesting aspect (everyone is contradictory, finance is infinite complicity, etc). De Man notes that the scopic manipulability of blindness in aesthetic zones is not really a human thing anyway. Its inevitability means that, however costly, it literally cannot be *subjectively* adjusted or seen (even right now, right here at this moment of reading).

Even ifâ€”or especially ifâ€”I know NFT technology can vastly accelerate the already prohibitive costs of global art, I am also incapable, as *normative* subject, of *not* forgetting this. In fact, the forgetting is the first thing that art needs to *be* art. Precisely what is *exponentially* [â€˜normalâ€™](https://twitter.com/CharlieFang77/status/1431183749023027201) for art in 2021 is that art be indifferent to the extremity of extinction.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fb84b21fc-c3e0-455b-99f1-74afb2ea6db5_500x620.png)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O6nbU0ZQP1zCawlf6VwSd.png?height=390&width=872)

Here is how de Man expressed the bind:

> Rather than putting it in terms that suggest deceit and duplicity, one could say that the poet, like the philosopher, must *forget* what he knows about his undertaking in order to accede to the discourse to which he is committed.

No one artist is responsible for the extincto-collaborative nature of contemporary crypto artâ€”after, for some, â€˜the vibe shiftâ€™â€”but this is not to say (some) *one* does not know what the cost is, and that there is no risk in calling it (as an empty allegorical IYKYK â€˜jokeâ€™) â€˜normalâ€™. Since one can do nothing, the temptation is to treble down into the forgetting, as if the layer in which the art is made is itself amnesia.

But since one can only remain disturbed by the (un)consciousness of forgetting, it is a delusion to think one has entirely forgotten. This illusion itselfâ€”increasingly normal, so it seemsâ€”is also increasingly *what is sold*. The â€˜normalâ€™â€”HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA, as the laughters low of neoMaladyKaliacc would admitâ€”turns out to be the new holocaust to come.

**HOW TO GET FROM â€˜SIYUAN ZHAOâ€™ TO NEOCHIBI TO TREBLINKA GOLD**

> It follows (in accordance with a priori synthesis) that a robust cryptocurrency will take the form of artificial gold.â€”Nick Land, *Crypto-Current*

It is impossible to think of digital art and not think of Gold at some point, for example Pindarâ€™s holy Gold in Heidegger as a name for Being or what Land calls â€˜artificial goldâ€™. It is impossible to think of Gold without eventually thinkingâ€”at some obscure point in consciousness and its corruptionâ€”of the figure of â€˜the Jewâ€™. Perhaps deeper and more controversial still, the NFT market seems to create New Slaves. Kanye knew this by surmise, and itâ€™s not a point that demands the pedantic detailism of examples. (In the zone of art as it is, *detailism* increases the everyday devil.)

Everyone at least knows that in some point in the pastâ€”so long ago!!! like 2020â€”an absolute value was attached to something called â€˜anti-capitalâ€™. The strange fact is that in America, under Biden, the power of such a â€˜resistanceâ€™ is less than ever apparent. The artificial Gold Rush is slaying the normative tribe.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F2f74953b-9e3d-4684-9efd-848417a03af4_500x625.jpeg)

Can we imagine a Milady in Treblinka and should we? To do so is to place art in a proximity to genocide so obtrusive that it begs the severe hopefree question. In the first â€˜No NFTSâ€™ essay, the comparison of an artwork with a â€˜watercooler in Treblinkaâ€™ was just that egregious display. But NFTs are already acutely *historical*, so how *not* so serious? Or why and how *pause* entrapped inside the beauty of normative oblivion?

The camps are meant to be an exception, even now, even given a world of constant forgetting of â€˜never forgetâ€™. Where Siyuan Zhao had an aggressive relation with art itself (Miami, and so on), Milady is almost all cute amnesia and its fun-law, the indifference to indifference and shine shrine. No blood this time.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F27993612-d965-421a-a3d0-7194faa31bb1_1200x800.jpeg)

To say Milady cannot be pictured in Treblinka or at Miami Beach because it is offensive is to make it impossible to ever again take total human genocide seriously as a category. If angelicism is a formal gesture, it is the gesture of pushing back against the illusion that anything can or should be put ahead of what Grothendieck calls the â€˜infinite quantityâ€™ and pricelessness of the current species on earth (humanimal). Angelicism places itself, at almost all costs, between the human and the â€˜something elseâ€™ of absolute niche finality (cosmic burn-all). It counts holocausts (impossibly).

To be nonpedantic, this means having to bear the thought that Jewishness and the Holocaust cannot be at the centre of any contemporary account of pain. On the contrary. Moreover, this would be the point of imagining Milady in Treblinka, to bring up that immense problem of relativisation. The problem is not just that there is more than one holocaust depending on who you ask culturally, but that the threat of total extinction is in fact a greater matheme. Besides, surely little Milady is *ready*.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY&feature=emb_title](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY&feature=emb_title)

Even if it is inevitable that we increasingly ignore the following fact, there is, according to at least one market pitch, nothing more worthy of speculation than the *holocaust to come*.

**DIGITAL CHRIST**

> By 2035, demand is expected to double for germanium; quadruple for tantalum; and quintuple for palladium. The scandium market could increase nine-fold, and the cobalt market by a factor of 24.â€”Guillaume Pitron

So, what *is* network spirituality? Will it turn out to be a value? Or, conversely, are all the angels of heaven a spoilsport distraction from falling in love with Digital Christâ€™s actual eyes?

Let us say there is such a thing as _non_minting, both in life and art. There is radical purity, perhaps, and radical emptiness. There is Angelic mind and there are non-networks. Land makes a reference to Mou Zongsan and â€˜the Eastâ€™, crucially, in the section ofÂ *Crypto-Current*Â that discusses â€˜Kantian angelic mindâ€™. Here is what he says:

> The practical actualization of intellectual intuition is modeledâ€”spontaneouslyâ€”as an explosion because it is comparable to the withdrawal of graphite rods controlling a nuclear fission reaction. An inhibitor is removed. In the East, the catalysis of â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ through methodical subtraction of an obstacle is no less pointedly thematized, even if it is approached from the other side, and in the opposite direction.

In effect, Kantian angelic mind (angelicism as pure time and purchase and price) is available without the support of Western method-objects. As Land puts it, â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ is valorised from the other side, that is, the side originally with no (â€˜digitalâ€™) network as such. The subtraction of an obstacle (the nonpedantic) does the thing we want beyond or before what AI or the internet yet can. The true internet, letâ€™s say, is ancient, and the only thing of great price.

A more detailed description is found here: â€˜Milady Maker is a collection of 10,000 generative pfpNFTâ€™s in a neochibi aesthetic with randomized cosmetics inspired by 00â€™s Tokyo street fashion. Under the vision of digital artist Milady Sonora, Miladyâ€™s are designed to be fashion-minded and genuinely good social media avatars, and an invitation into their personal aesthetic world.â€™

**KANTIAN ANGELIC MIND**

A further paradox in the original NFT essay was that according to one of the most evolved theorists of crypto in its *philosophical* aspectsâ€”Nick Landâ€”the release triggered by digital money inside technological signatures and rationality is itself angelicist in mood.

In his *[Crypto-Current](https://etscrivner.github.io/cryptocurrent/)* text, Land writes:

> AI is thus positioned, implicitly, in the place of a Kantian angelic mind, liberated from the anthopomorphic proscription upon direct self-modification of its own cognitive processes.

In other words, though we may expect the achievements of crypto-intelligence to consist of release from theogenic tropes, some of those tropesâ€”specifically, angelicismâ€”are already the height of what any digital shift can achieve.

Pure money as achieved rationality is also pure angelicism. There is nothing to update beyond angelism as rationality itself. Angelicism is the unupdateable. We are already as artificially intelligent as we can be. It (angelicism) is it.

The implication for NFT production is as radical as it is superfluous. That is, it will beâ€”radicallyâ€”ignored.

And yet, the implication *cannot not be* named. It *cannot not be* iterated, just as NFTs *cannot not be* producedâ€”both momentums, if you like, are part of the same essentially entropic ass vibes of aesthetic â€˜historyâ€™ rn.

**THE IMPLICATION**

The implication can be stated in terms of poetic cognition. Paul de Man said that when you see beautiful poetry itâ€™s almost impossible to resist, and not your fault for going ahead and (not) doing so, but it doesnâ€™t mean beautiful poetry is not lethal.

The same can be said of the spread of NFTs, and their latest â€˜Miladyâ€™ manifestationâ€”the beauty, fun, and unsummarisability of this Neochibi trend may be pictured in the context of [a water cooler in Treblinka](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-nfts-not-now-the-return-of-post). It is itselfâ€”holocaustically, impossibly, glossilyâ€”*fun*.

This perhaps sounds like nothing (everything) but it is probably everything (nothing) that nobody wants to think. We are saying that this argument about the extinction-costs (see links above) of all art right now willâ€”by definitionâ€”be ignored.

The brain of history does not and cannot read this *as what it sees* more than anything else in 2021. *It* is addicted to *its* indifference. NFTs are the summation of an indifference to indifference (â€˜funâ€™) and little else.

Even if it is inevitable that we increasingly ignore the following fact, there is, according to at least one market pitch, nothing more worthy of speculation than the *holocaust to come*.

**DIGITAL CHRIST**

> By 2035, demand is expected to double for germanium; quadruple for tantalum; and quintuple for palladium. The scandium market could increase nine-fold, and the cobalt market by a factor of 24.â€”Guillaume Pitron

So, what *is* network spirituality? Will it turn out to be a value? Or, conversely, are all the angels of heaven a spoilsport distraction from falling in love with Digital Christâ€™s actual eyes?

Let us say there is such a thing as _non_minting, both in life and art. There is radical purity, perhaps, and radical emptiness. There is Angelic mind and there are non-networks. Land makes a reference to Mou Zongsan and â€˜the Eastâ€™, crucially, in the section ofÂ *Crypto-Current*Â that discusses â€˜Kantian angelic mindâ€™. Here is what he says:

> The practical actualization of intellectual intuition is modeledâ€”spontaneouslyâ€”as an explosion because it is comparable to the withdrawal of graphite rods controlling a nuclear fission reaction. An inhibitor is removed. In the East, the catalysis of â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ through methodical subtraction of an obstacle is no less pointedly thematized, even if it is approached from the other side, and in the opposite direction.

In effect, Kantian angelic mind (angelicism as pure time and purchase and price) is available without the support of Western method-objects. As Land puts it, â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ is valorised from the other side, that is, the side originally with no (â€˜digitalâ€™) network as such. The subtraction of an obstacle (the nonpedantic) does the thing we want beyond or before what AI or the internet yet can. The true internet, letâ€™s say, is ancient, and the only thing of great price.

### Footnotes

1. A really expensive hyperlink with an absurd carbon footprint, etc.
2. I call this nonpedantic rendition of overness ubilapse.
3. A more detailed description is found here: â€˜Milady Maker is a collection of 10,000 generative pfpNFTâ€™s in a neochibi aesthetic with randomized cosmetics inspired by 00â€™s Tokyo street fashion. Under the vision of digital artist Milady Sonora, Miladyâ€™s are designed to be fashion-minded and genuinely good social media avatars, and an invitation into their personal aesthetic world.â€™

title: The Hangover
body:
Weâ€™re all feeling it. Groggy, eyes blurry, feels like you havenâ€™t slept in days because you havenâ€™t and your eye is twitching from checking Coingecko so often. Whether youâ€™re in crypto, capital markets or work at literally any company in America, this weekâ€™s market affected you.

But honestly dude \*rubs eyes\* I donâ€™t even remember what happened last nightâ€¦

## The Pre-Game

*Song playing: Old Town Road - Lil Nas 0x*

Thereâ€™s nothing like a good house party to get the night going, especially after a long work week. December 14, 2018 and ETH is bottoming at $84 after a year of down only; next stop? The moon. Little did we knowâ€¦

Luckily stonks like SPX had also bottomed that week, and thus began the pre-game party that rode the SPX up nearly 40% until March 2020, the pandemic. The Saudi Prince hacking [Jeff Bezos phone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jeff_Bezos_phone_hacking#:\~:text=In%20January%202020%2C%20the%20FTI,States%20has%20denied%20the%20allegations.) was a good sign the party was getting stated.

## The Party

*Song playing: (T)WAP - Cardi B*

Russia and Saudi Arabia started an oil price war in February 2020 and then covid hit. March 2020 was like arriving to a house party early. Itâ€™s really shitty until you figure out the scene - whereâ€™s the bathroom, whereâ€™s the ice, who has the drugs - except everyone wants the drugs (vaccines) and dealer are charging exorbitant prices. And itâ€™s a masquerade.

Only 6 months later Bitcoin and SPX recovered and reached *all time highs.* Toilet paper was more in demand than the dollar, everyone was shaving their head or making sourdough. Things started to get crazy bro, remember the first DeFi Summer? Compound had just revolutionized DeFi with community governance and frog nation was on the rise. 1 Yearn = 1 BTC was proof of concept that an ETH-based currency could be store of value. And Iâ€™ll never forget walking over to play beer pong when I saw Novogratz shilling SUSHI on CNBC. The entire nutritional food pyramid had been tokenized and a snapshot of Lebron taking a shot sold for $200,000.

Rekt.news was founded and flash loans were picking up steam. Web3 was also *finally* being realized as acts like Twitter banning Trump in January 2021 proved the need for censorship resistance infrastructure. The metaverse was a dream being chased and if you didnâ€™t have an NFT you couldnâ€™t sit with us.

In Q1 2021 we were so high on NFTs, we had convinced ourselves that SHIB at $8 billion valuation was mainstream adoption. SPX continued to soar thanks to money printer go brrr and interest rates were at their lowest ever. Then Coinbase IPO was the local top and we got bored, so so bored. SO bored that Bored Apes Yacht Club was invented in April 2021, as solace for the pandemic soul. It only took 5 months for Steph Curry to join the ape party. Next thing we knew, the rather orderly stablecoin experiment hit 5th gear with new stables like the uncollateralized and unpegged (3,3).

In October 2021, SHIB market cap was $41 billion, about the same market cap as Etsy, and Tesla would soon start accepting Dogecoin. In retrospect, bankers analyzing Elonâ€™s tweeting trends to predict Doge movements is about as ridiculous as taking the 10th shot of tequila before you go to the bar. By the end of 2021, over $17 billion in NFTs were traded, the GDP of Botswana. We shouldâ€™ve known the party was almost over when dad arrived, Meta. At least we had the friends and anons we made along the way, it was one of the best parties weâ€™d ever been to.

## The Hangover

*Song playing: The Morning - The Weeknd*

Everything that seemed sustainable during the pandemic is proving not to be. It seems crazy how much we believed, some call it mass psychosis, but maybe if everyone is crazy then nobody is crazy. Remember Clubhouse? This hangover will check our hubris.

In 2021 companies like Peloton had their cake, convincing us to buy a bike for $1,500 and pay an additional $50 per month to use it, instead of us buying a $100 classic bicycle. Peloton closed this week with $500 million in losses. Today SoftBankâ€™s vision fund posted a $20 billion loss, only a year after it was the most profitable Japanese company. Meanwhile you can watch the play by play of $4.6 billion of their wreckage on the hit show WeWorked on Hulu! Even our dot-com darling Apple is down 22% this year.

The dollar, oil prices and inflation are at all time high, a monetary trilemma of sorts. While war is the Russia-Ukraine war is the prevailing crisis, The sanctions that aim to punish the offenders are punishing other global vendors.

While it feels like weâ€™re close to the bottom (and maybe we are!) my gut tells me the worse is yet to come. We must still be drunk because a Warhol just [sold for $195 million](https://www.washingtonpost.com/arts-entertainment/2022/05/10/andy-warhol-marilyn-monroe-painting-auction/), the most ever paid for any American artistâ€™s work. Professionals like Julian Emanuel of Evercore isi say that we wonâ€™t see proper capitulation until the VIX is above 40 or the puts to calls ratio is above 135 (more people betting itâ€™ll go more down than itâ€™ll go up) and [Arthur Hayes](https://blog.bitmex.com/the-q-trap/) bought crash June 2022 puts. I heard recently that SPX below 4k would be a free fall, we touched sub 3.9k this week. But how are credit markets? Have we felt enough pain?

The Fed waited until over 8% inflation to start quantitative tightening. On the plus side, medical care and services are only inflated 3.5%. 50 bps rate hikes are confirmed for the next several meetings in the US, meanwhile China refuses to raise rates and Europe is moving slow - is there consensus? Should there be? India is considering shutting its exports of wheat to protect domestic supply, not only is Shanghai locked down but Beijing is close to a quarantine and Europe is literally meters away from war.

Ongoing supply chains, oil prices spiking and foreign inflation isnâ€™t helping the case. Argentina has [55% inflation](https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/with-argentine-inflation-seen-topping-6-bricklayer-struggles-survive-2022-04-13/#:\~:text=The%20INDEC%20statistics%20agency%20said,highest%20since%202002%2C%20INDEC%20said.) and [49% interest rate](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-pmn/argentina-hikes-interest-rate-to-49-in-bid-to-tame-inflation). Take that in. Even the companies you thought had their shit together 6 months ago are facing frenzy. Twitter and Meta have announced hiring freezes.

Cryptoâ€™s high beta exacerbated the impact on the web3 community. While many say The Unpegging of UST was obvious, and there certainly was a lot of vocal criticism, itâ€™s easy to see why thousands of investors would support the idea when most of our nation states rely/relied on similar mechanisms. Itâ€™s hypocritical for Yellen to disparage UST in congress when the Federal Reserve has played the same games with gold and following Bretton Woods. Any attempts to hinder token innovation that strives away from that model is an attack on monetary rights.

This is one of the sad truths, had there been enough of a bailout like 2008 perhaps Terra/UST would have survived, but they took on too much debt while not enough people cared. I wonder what wouldâ€™ve happened had more of the Ethereum or Cosmos community been involved? What if it was similar to EIP999, would UST have been bailed out? Was the issue bad debt or just bad marketing? Some called it an attack, I would call it the invisible hand. But just like you always invite back the guy who drank too much, people can always [return to Rome](https://twitter.com/Galois_Capital/status/1524365468752138241).

Experts like [Zoltan Pozsar](https://open.spotify.com/episode/4X2bzlmNhres1kcMq6LQWa) feel these events are larger than simple inflation, weâ€™re experiencing a global repricing event and what he calls Bretton Woods III. What will be the new global reserve currency? Which commodities will become the backbone of our future economies?

Our hearts say to keep partying - the web3 revolution and new monetary system are the new frontier - but our bodies say we need to rest.

## The Recovery

*Song playing: Donâ€™t Stop Me Now - Queen*

What should make us feel better is weâ€™re not alone. Misery likes company and the company is filled with suits, nerds, retail and funds.

### Hydrate

Youâ€™re likely dehydrated, physically and financially. However, if weâ€™re heading to a rumored recession and the Fed follows through with its QT starting this month, the drought will continue.

A recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth. While Q1 2022 saw 6.5% US GDP growth - down [1.4% from Q4](https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2022/04/28/gdp-2022-q1-economy/), itâ€™s not negative growth. So *if* a recession is coming, itâ€™s likely not to be in 2022. Plan for at least 12 months of runway if not 36 months.

If youâ€™re a start up, learn from comrades [Consensys](https://ethereumworldnews.com/ethereum-developer-consensys-layoff-employees/), [Status](https://www.coindesk.com/markets/2018/12/14/ethereum-chat-startup-status-lays-off-25-of-staff/) and [WeWork](https://www.forbes.com/sites/samanthasharf/2020/04/30/wework-unraveling-continues-with-new-layoff-round/) and prioritize long-term sustainability. If youâ€™re a regulator, listen to the voices of the innovators instead of the capital allocators. If youâ€™re an institution, take the lessons from the gamestop short squeeze and support the nerds and meme artists building the worldâ€™s new technologies.

### Vitamins & Electrolytes

A hangover always gets better with some gatorade. Treat yourself to standard self-care practices - take an exercise class, meditate, read a book, pay with fiat. Lastly, treat yourself to that ginger shot and green smoothie, itâ€™s cheaper than making it yourself!

The crypto market is 24/7 behind devices that heat up our gonads and hypnotize our eyeballs that itâ€™s easy to forget the real world. It might be time to take a break from the metaverse. We didnâ€™t deserve $150,000 SOCKS yet. Do you have clean white socks for the summer?

### Rest

Burnout is real and many have been building from the 2018 bear market through 2022. Take this time to rest, recharge, ideate. We used to say bear markets were good for building as cope, but now we know itâ€™s true. Ethereum alone tripled its market cap from peak to peak (2017-2022). If thatâ€™s not proof of concept that *build, play, rest, repeat* works, I donâ€™t know what is.

### Rebuild

Good jobs reports mean a lot of people want / need to work, this is great for crypto because most of those web2 and fiat contributors are probably bored and in need of a new revolutionary mission to get behind.

But we canâ€™t just hire crypto experts, we have to create the pipeline of 0 to hireable to make sure weâ€™re growing the pie of talent. The plus side of an economic slowdown is more time. Letâ€™s take the time to train new contributors to go 0 to hireable so we poach less and recruit more.

Another plus side is most funds have finished raising. Whether itâ€™s a16z, Variant Fund, Sequoia Archetype or others, most funds spent the last 12 months raising so they could support more founders. So while the economy slows down, expect venture capital to stay sharp. The biggest bets are made in a bear market.

[https://twitter.com/cburniske/status/1524840747005923328](https://twitter.com/cburniske/status/1524840747005923328)

This is not financial advice.

title: 10: Journey of The Stranger
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local 
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625) 
 **Current whereabouts**: Node 787 
 **Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

Iâ€™m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have beenâ€¦interesting, but Iâ€™ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still donâ€™t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. Itâ€™s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I canâ€™t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792). 

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmission for your perusal at a later date. Be well.


---

### From the journal of Erkeil The Stranger. Day 15

![Erkeil The Stranger](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7B9PrMnpPXEY47t3dsDSP.png?height=400&width=400)

Though it seems like an age, itâ€™s been little more than a fortnight since I woke in this land. Everything is strange and unfamiliar to me, and I, as well, am strange, even to myself.

What I know of my past is given to me in dreams, fragments of memory, though even so, Iâ€™m cannot be sure which are my own, or if they belong to another. I do not know who I am. I donâ€™t feel completely at home is this body, nor do I feel completely alone in my thoughts. Itâ€™s as if there is another presence, perhaps more than one, sharing my thoughts. I am one, but not alone.

There is Hadrian, my newâ€¦I will call him a companion, though, in fact he is more akin to a thrall, enslaved in some sense and bound to me by the weirding power held within the strange iron crown that rides my brow. We met on the road, after the fog and I think he meant me ill, as so many I have encountered have. I am stillâ€¦unclear what forced the change in him, but know it is related to the crown that marks me as stranger.

Hadrian calls me â€œErkeilâ€ but I am unsure if it is a name or a title. Though we share a common tongue, Hadrian speaks little and often seems lost or confused, an affect I ascribe to the power of the crown.

![Hadrian The Thrall](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2-IwFhU0CeeTiE4gsUQwr.png?height=250&width=250)

What do I know about myself? Very little. I appear to be a youngling, my skin dark and smooth. I awoke alone, my first sight being the tip of an iron spike from the crown, and then the ivory branches of the tree I was laying against, followed by an open sky filled with stars. And then the churchâ€¦and the lone butterfly who lead me there.

The church, the bonfireâ€¦what strange and unsettling spectacle that was. Iâ€™ve avoided too much thinking on it and have made it a point to avoid those whose eyes burn with dedication to Agoraâ€™s light. Still, it was that night that I first realized the power within the crown, though I wasnâ€™t sure what it meant or how to use it. Some connection there? Perhaps. The thought chills my bones. The Motherâ€™s fire feels cold to me.

I wonderâ€¦was I pulled from another world as that hideous ape creature was? Is it my destiny to share its fate? More and more questions, and no answers.

I had nothing, aside from the rags and the crown, and it wasnâ€™t long after the fog cleared and the influence of Agora faded before I was consumed by ravenous hunger. Thankfully I realized Iâ€™ve some skill for thievery and an opportunity to practice it presented itself in the form of a nearby farmstead. I never did see the owners, but Iâ€™m thankful for their talent with baking and their bountiful harvest.

I also have some martial skill. This was proven on my third night after the fog when I was attacked by would-be robbers. Though they had little skill themselves, the ease with which I bested them spoke to great cunning and mastery. Theyâ€”armed as they were and I clad only in tattered cloth and still weakened besidesâ€”should have made me easy prey. What they expected to gain from the venture is unclear, as I had little. Perhaps the iron thorns that crown my head? Another mystery.

I look upon that encounter as fortunate, as in their deaths I found armor and weaponry that have proved their value several times over in this forsaken and deadly land. And they had full packs; equipment and provisions.

And this journal, which was empty but for a single half-finished entry written in a tongue, I do not understand.

I felt no remorse for their killing. It felt almost natural to me. I think I am no stranger to violence, though my body doesnâ€™t seem at all suited to it. Itâ€™s strange. I do regret their deaths, as I I have to wonder, if Iâ€™d learned the trick of persuasion and bondage from the crown, would those two also be enthralled to me? That might have been a missed opportunity. Something to explore as I make my way in this world.

Hadrian stirs, so I will stop my account with questions to ponder. I have felt the power of this strange crown, how it bonds Hadrian to me, but there is something else. I can feel another or others, linked through the crownâ€¦am I bound as well? And if so, to who? Or what?

\~ Erkeil

title: 08: CyberBroker Investigations
body:
### Transmission from Valgueri The Myriad

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / Feb 1, 2022, Prime Earth Local  
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625)
**Current whereabouts**: Node 787
**Collection / Sphere reference:** [CyberBrokers](https://cyberbrokers.io/)

Iâ€™ve slowly come to realize that Iâ€™m in dire need of better representation. I need to engage an entity that has ties into some form of reality; even if itâ€™s not the Prime, but also can move between spheres. I need someone whoâ€™s not The Operator, and not confined to a single virtual space.

Iâ€™ve been somewhat frustrated in my efforts of late. Prime Valgueriâ€™s disappearance and The Operatorâ€™sâ€¦struggles around managing our financials have left me in a bit of a bind. So, Iâ€™ve been searching. One option has been to engage the services of a CyberBroker.

If nothing else I can hope they can deal with the speculators that seem to plague every corner of these worlds. Itâ€™s clear that The Operator struggles with this, and until we can contact Prime Valgueri, I need to rely on him forâ€¦too many things. He needs help. We need help.

Mostly Iâ€™ve found only rumors, but what I hear about CyberBrokers seems promising. Identities that fit seamlessly within the metaverse, ostensibly across spheres, my hope is that engaging one will benefit not only The Operator but my investigations as well.

But what Iâ€™ve heard is mostly hearsay. And all of that is filtered through The Operatorâ€™sâ€¦how can I put this? The Operator has limited knowledge and seems often distracted. What I get from him is often incomplete. Iâ€™m starting to feel like heâ€™s a bitâ€¦slow? I guess.

Nevertheless, what I hear is interesting. I need someone capable, yet flexible, who can help The Operator help me, but also assist as I dive farther into the Deeps. I need someone savvy; someone who can go to places where I cannot, and interface with parts of these virtual worlds Iâ€™ve struggled to understand. At the same time, Iâ€™ll need them to get along well with the others.

To that end, Iâ€™ve been investigating several proto CyberBrokers. The information Iâ€™ve been given has been somewhat limited, what I have learned is interesting. I donâ€™t know their names, but have given themâ€¦colorful monikers to differentiate.

![CyberBrokers](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QsdaqYK-LTekZ27n0EQO8.jpg?height=600&width=1200)

**Amber** is the most flexible of the three, and the one most likely to be able to tolerate the other entities Iâ€™ve gathered; though itâ€™s unclear how they will react to the magic. They seem open-minded and enthusiastic, but also rather frivolous at times. Would I need to worry about them losing focus? Still, their skills are balanced and I suspect their operator is committed. As well, Iâ€™ve noticed an uncommon ability to adapt and blend in that I think would prove highly advantageous.

**Cerulean** is less subtle. I have concerns about his ability toâ€¦get alongâ€¦with the others, but there is no doubting his talent and intellect. Of the three he is the most technical, a skill I value highly, especially given The Operatorâ€™s shortcomings. But I would worry quite a lot about his interactions and how they reflected upon me. Would I be able to control him? I have some doubts.

**Violet** seems the most in line with my own essence. I donâ€™t have a solid impression of her operator, but she seems a curious and thoughtful entity, with a lot of empathy. She seems like sheâ€™d be the easier of the three to manage, but I do worry about her ability to handle some of the more stressful situations she might encounter.

As an option though, the CyberBrokers seems more than interesting. Of course, this will bear more investigation. I think my next step will be to have Jujube assess if she is willing. Any interaction between the mage and these CyberBrokes will be highly telling I suspect.


---

Note to Nine: Iâ€™ve not heard anything from you in several weeks. I admit that Iâ€™ve checked on you and things seem to be going well at Ravensbridge, but Iâ€™m curious. Iâ€™ve asked The Operator to be in touch with you. Please let him know if you need assistance or help with anything.

title: 10: Journey of The Stranger

**Current cycle:** 1092 PH / June 18, 2022, Prime Earth Local 
 **Current virtual identity**: Valgueri as [Protealax](https://opensea.io/assets/0xa406489360a47af2c74fc1004316a64e469646a5/9625) 
 **Current whereabouts**: Node 787 
 **Collection / Sphere reference:** [We Are All Going To Die](https://twitter.com/wagdie_eth)

Iâ€™m sorry for the silence these last few months. Things have beenâ€¦interesting, but Iâ€™ve had little time to reflect. Alas, I still donâ€™t, at least not on my own situation. Nine has been mostly incommunicado as well, embroiled, I think, with events at Ravensbridge. I trust that she is alright, but have been distracted enough with my own studies to worry about her.

More will come later, for now, I want to share an interesting find. Itâ€™s a somewhat cryptic journal, sent to me from an anonymous source. I canâ€™t be certain, but I think it has been transcribed by hand and then coded and sent via arcane means, direct from the source: an entity that calls themselves [Erkeil The Stranger](https://opensea.io/assets/ethereum/0x659a4bdaaacc62d2bd9cb18225d9c89b5b697a5a/5792). 

Sharing now without further commentary. Nine, if you are reading this, I will forward further transmission for your perusal at a later date. Be well.
