title: MEV access on Ropsten testnet (pre-release)
body:
> Due to increased community interest, this is a pre-released guide on how to test mev-boost on Ropsten testnet.

*Shoutout to [realbigsean](https://github.com/realbigsean) from SigmaPrime for his guidance and insights and [Yorick](https://github.com/yorickdowne) from EthStaker for feedback and review*

***\*\*\*Disclaimer\*\*\****

* ***You are about to touch code under active development which has NOT yet hit the* â€˜*unstableâ€™ branch of Lighthouse.***
* ***Moreover, you will need to self-build the required Docker image (see â€˜Interludeâ€™ section below). It has been tested with a specific Git commit.***
* ***This guide will be updated (and simplified) as soon as corresponding official unstable/stable Docker images by SigmaPrime will have been published.***
* ***Lighthouse Devs are thankful for community feedback, e.g. in their [Discord](https://discord.gg/cyAszAh).***


---

*This post aims to provide a quick and minimalistic setup guide on how to test accessing MEV as a validator on the Ropsten testnet.*

*[In a preceding guide](https://mirror.xyz/ladislaus.eth/O5bW3rDnKITHlCXE9K_0IwiEwDrc6qw-y3MpX0EUcew) I tried to highlight essential requirements for running an Ethereum node post-merge using Ubuntu & Docker. With* `mev-boost` *as an optional, additional piece of software in the node stack, I try to leverage* `docker-compose` *this time.*

## MEVvvhatâ€¦?!

Maximum Extractable Value is a controversial topic within the Ethereum ecosystem. As the network has experienced increased adoption and settlement value, profitable opportunities to insert TXs at particular places of a block have become more prevalent.

These practices are often referred to as *front-running*, among others, implying centralisation vectors and even chain instabilities. Hence, the ultimate goal for blockchain R&D is to minimize (or eliminate?!) such negative externalities for users and the network as a whole. A first step towards mitigating them is to democratize access to MEV.

> In essence, MEV boils down to the fundamental question of how the process of fair transaction ordering in a block is supposed to happen in the most trust-minimised fashion.

Technically, a validator -representing the proposer of a block- defaults to asking the local Execution Layer Client for a particular transaction order (typically ranked by the highest paying TX fees). However, thereâ€™s also the option to ask a third-party **relay** for a pre-constructed block, e.g. [Flashbots](https://docs.flashbots.net/), a collective operating an external block builder protocol. A relay is a doubly-trusted intermediary matching specialised builders on the one hand with validators on the other hand.

![src: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/flashbots/mev-boost/main/docs/mev-boost-integration-overview.png?&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&size=medium)

Node operators can access MEV with the help of a software called `mev-boost` by Flashbots. In the given case, if itâ€™s the validatorâ€™s turn to propose a block, the CL client Lighthouse will ask both mev-boost and the EL client Besu for a block, ultimately opting for the better paying one.

*Note:*

* *At the time of writing no one is sending transaction bundles to the Flashbots relay on Ropsten (i.e. there are no more valuable blocks from the relay to process)*
* *In case a relay provided the validator with an invalid block (header), which turned out to be invalid after the validator client had signed it, this does **not** represent a slashable event (rather leads to a missed proposal).*

Read about how [Flashbots argues for running mev-boost](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost). And feel free to dive deeper into the woods [here](https://twitter.com/lightclients/status/1533915131536605185), [here](https://youtu.be/vhxIjEnhutw) and [here](https://youtu.be/OD54WfVuDWw). Thereâ€™s a bunch of open social, technical and cryptoeconomic research and design questions to be tackled.


---

### Interlude: self-build the Lighthouse Docker image locally

> *This step can be omitted as soon as the necessary code will have been included in the unstable branch of the Lighthouse repository.*

**1)** Navigate in a CLI into your `/home` directory. Download the proper source files from a given Github repository and a given commit hash (*has been tested*):

*More adventurous users could try out later commits on [this branch](https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/tree/pre-bellatrix-blinded-blocks). They might not be stable, however, as it is currently under active development.*

```
$ git clone -n https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/; cd lighthouse
$ git checkout d12d03b2b0165e67f5ebc63db575d8925ddf05c5
```

**2)** Build the docker image (may take some time):

```
$ docker build . -t lighthouse:mevboost-develop
```


---

## How to access MEV on Ropsten

For the sake of this demo, I chose Besu by ConsenSys as an EL client. It comes with a lean new database structure called [â€œBonsai triesâ€ and offers implicit pruning functionality](https://consensys.net/blog/news/test-staking-ahead-of-the-merge-with-improved-bonsai-tries-state-storage/), lowering disk space usage and avoiding potential downtimes for manual pruning. Snap sync is also about to hit the latest release. Lighthouse by SigmaPrime serves as CL client (i.e. Beacon Node & Validator Client).

### Prerequisites

* [Ubuntu & pre-installed docker compose](https://eth-docker.net/docs/Usage/Prerequisites/#ubuntu-prerequisites)
* [A validator keystore for Ropsten](https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-ropsten.md#trying-the-ropsten-testnet)
* Specify [--suggested-fee-recipient](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/suggested-fee-recipient.html)
* *Optionally* modify the data directories that get mounted from the host into the Besu/Lighthouse docker containers

### Run a complete node stack with mev-boost

**1)** Navigate to your `/home` directory. Create a project directory with subfolders:

```
$ mkdir -p ETHclient/{besu,lighthouse-bn,lighthouse-vc,validator_keys,JWT}; cd ETHclient
```

**2)** Generate a [JasonWebToken (JWT)](https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/05/30/ropsten-merge-announcement/) in order for the EL and CL client to communicate securely:

```
$ openssl rand -hex 32 | tr -d "\n" > "$(pwd)/JWT/jwtsecret"
```

**3)** Paste the validator keystore(s) in the host directory `./validator_keys`

**4)** [Add the validator key to Lighthouse](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/validator-import-launchpad.html#docker)

```
$ docker run -it -v $(pwd)/lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse -v $(pwd)/validator_keys:/validator_keys lighthouse:mevboost-develop lighthouse --network ropsten account validator import --directory /validator_keys
```

**5)** Copy & Paste the below attached docker-compose code in a newly created file to be named `besu-lh-mevboost.yaml` in the project directory.

**6)** Start the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten up -d
```

**7)** Eventually, stop the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten stop
```


---

```yaml
version: "3.0"

services:
    beacon_node:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-bn
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-bn:/root/.lighthouse
            - ./JWT:/JWT            
        ports:
            - 9000:9000/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 9000:9000/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          beacon_node
          --datadir /root/.lighthouse/ropsten
          --eth1
          --http
          --http-address 0.0.0.0
          --http-allow-sync-stalled
          --merge
          --metrics
          --eth1-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8545
          --execution-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8551
          --jwt-secrets /JWT/jwtsecret
          --builder http://ropsten-mevboost:18550
          
    validator_client:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-vc
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse
        depends_on:
            - beacon_node
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          validator
          --metrics
          --metrics-address 0.0.0.0
          --beacon-nodes http://ropsten-bn:5052
          --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          --private-tx-proposals
        
    execution_client:
        image: hyperledger/besu:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-besu
        restart: on-failure
        environment:
            - "JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx4g"
        volumes:
            - ./besu:/opt/besu/data
            - ./JWT:/JWT
        ports:
            - 30303:30303/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 30303:30303/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          --network ropsten
          --data-path /opt/besu/data
          --data-storage-format BONSAI
          --rpc-http-enabled
          --rpc-http-host 0.0.0.0
          --rpc-http-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-http-cors-origins *
          --rpc-ws-enabled
          --rpc-ws-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-ws-host 0.0.0.0   
          --metrics-enabled
          --metrics-host 0.0.0.0
          --host-allowlist *
          --engine-host-allowlist *
          --engine-jwt-enabled
          --engine-jwt-secret /JWT/jwtsecret
        
    mev_boost:
        image: flashbots/mev-boost:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-mevboost
        restart: on-failure
        entrypoint:
            - /app/mev-boost
            - -addr
            - 0.0.0.0:18550
            - -ropsten
            - -relays
            - https://0xb124d80a00b80815397b4e7f1f05377ccc83aeeceb6be87963ba3649f1e6efa32ca870a88845917ec3f26a8e2aa25c77@builder-relay-ropsten.flashbots.net
            
networks:
    ETHclient_net:
        driver: bridge
```


---

### Closing Remarks

Obviously, the more testnet validators you run, the higher the likelihood of being randomly selected to propose a block (i.e. you likely have to wait less long)

**Watch out for the following logs in mev-boost:**

```
level=info msg="getHeader: successfully got more valuable payload header"

level=info msg="getPayload: received payload from relay"
```

**And check if your block has made it on-chain:**

`https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/<yourblocknumber>`


---

\*\*\*\*

*Please keep in mind this is a testnet guide that may contain mistakes and that takes shortcuts which come with trade-offs. It could quickly become outdated as itâ€™s subject to ever evolving network and client changes.*

\*\*\*\*

Read about how [Flashbots argues for running mev-boost](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost). And feel free to dive deeper into the woods [here](https://twitter.com/lightclients/status/1533915131536605185), [here](https://youtu.be/vhxIjEnhutw) and [here](https://youtu.be/OD54WfVuDWw). Thereâ€™s a bunch of open social, technical and cryptoeconomic research and design questions to be tackled.


---

### Interlude: self-build the Lighthouse Docker image locally

> *This step can be omitted as soon as the necessary code will have been included in the unstable branch of the Lighthouse repository.*

**1)** Navigate in a CLI into your `/home` directory. Download the proper source files from a given Github repository and a given commit hash (*has been tested*):

*More adventurous users could try out later commits on [this branch](https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/tree/pre-bellatrix-blinded-blocks). They might not be stable, however, as it is currently under active development.*

```
$ git clone -n https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/; cd lighthouse
$ git checkout d12d03b2b0165e67f5ebc63db575d8925ddf05c5
```

**2)** Build the docker image (may take some time):

```
$ docker build . -t lighthouse:mevboost-develop
```


---

## How to access MEV on kiln

For the sake of this demo, I chose Besu by ConsenSys as an EL client. It comes with a lean new database structure called [â€œBonsai triesâ€ and offers implicit pruning functionality](https://consensys.net/blog/news/test-staking-ahead-of-the-merge-with-improved-bonsai-tries-state-storage/), lowering disk space usage and avoiding potential downtimes for manual pruning. Snap sync is also about to hit the latest release. Lighthouse by SigmaPrime serves as CL client (i.e. Beacon Node & Validator Client).

### Prerequisites

* [Ubuntu & pre-installed docker compose](https://eth-docker.net/docs/Usage/Prerequisites/#ubuntu-prerequisites)
* [A validator keystore for Ropsten](https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-ropsten.md#trying-the-ropsten-testnet)
* Specify [--suggested-fee-recipient](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/suggested-fee-recipient.html)
* *Optionally* modify the data directories that get mounted from the host into the Besu/Lighthouse docker containers

### Run a complete node stack with mev-boost

**1)** Navigate to your `/home` directory. Create a project directory with subfolders:

```
$ mkdir -p ETHclient/{besu,lighthouse-bn,lighthouse-vc,validator_keys,JWT}; cd ETHclient
```

**2)** Generate a [JasonWebToken (JWT)](https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/05/30/ropsten-merge-announcement/) in order for the EL and CL client to communicate securely:

```
$ openssl rand -hex 32 | tr -d "\n" > "$(pwd)/JWT/jwtsecret"
```

**3)** Paste the validator keystore(s) in the host directory `./validator_keys`

**4)** [Add the validator key to Lighthouse](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/validator-import-launchpad.html#docker)

```
$ docker run -it -v $(pwd)/lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse -v $(pwd)/validator_keys:/validator_keys lighthouse:mevboost-develop lighthouse --network ropsten account validator import --directory /validator_keys
```

**5)** Copy & Paste the below attached docker-compose code in a newly created file to be named `besu-lh-mevboost.yaml` in the project directory.

**6)** Start the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten up -d
```

**7)** Eventually, stop the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten stop
```


---

```yaml
version: "3.0"

services:
    beacon_node:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-bn
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-bn:/root/.lighthouse
            - ./JWT:/JWT            
        ports:
            - 9000:9000/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 9000:9000/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          beacon_node
          --datadir /root/.lighthouse/ropsten
          --eth1
          --http
          --http-address 0.0.0.0
          --http-allow-sync-stalled
          --merge
          --metrics
          --eth1-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8545
          --execution-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8551
          --jwt-secrets /JWT/jwtsecret
          --builder http://ropsten-mevboost:18550
          
    validator_client:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-vc
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse
        depends_on:
            - beacon_node
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          validator
          --metrics
          --metrics-address 0.0.0.0
          --beacon-nodes http://ropsten-bn:5052
          --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          --private-tx-proposals
        
    execution_client:
        image: hyperledger/besu:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-besu
        restart: on-failure
        environment:
            - "JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx4g"
        volumes:
            - ./besu:/opt/besu/data
            - ./JWT:/JWT
        ports:
            - 30303:30303/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 30303:30303/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          --network ropsten
          --data-path /opt/besu/data
          --data-storage-format BONSAI
          --rpc-http-enabled
          --rpc-http-host 0.0.0.0
          --rpc-http-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-http-cors-origins *
          --rpc-ws-enabled
          --rpc-ws-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-ws-host 0.0.0.0   
          --metrics-enabled
          --metrics-host 0.0.0.0
          --host-allowlist *
          --engine-host-allowlist *
          --engine-jwt-enabled
          --engine-jwt-secret /JWT/jwtsecret
        
    mev_boost:
        image: flashbots/mev-boost:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-mevboost
        restart: on-failure
        entrypoint:
            - /app/mev-boost
            - -addr
            - 0.0.0.0:18550
            - -ropsten
            - -relays
            - https://0xb124d80a00b80815397b4e7f1f05377ccc83aeeceb6be87963ba3649f1e6efa32ca870a88845917ec3f26a8e2aa25c77@builder-relay-ropsten.flashbots.net
            
networks:
    ETHclient_net:
        driver: bridge
```


---

### Closing Remarks

Obviously, the more testnet validators you run, the higher the likelihood of being randomly selected to propose a block (i.e. you likely have to wait less long)

**Watch out for the following logs in mev-boost:**

```
level=info msg="getHeader: successfully got more valuable payload header"

level=info msg="getPayload: received payload from relay"
```

**And check if your block has made it on-chain:**

`https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/<yourblocknumber>`


---

\*\*\*\*

*Please keep in mind this is a testnet guide that may contain mistakes and that takes shortcuts which come with trade-offs. It could quickly become outdated as itâ€™s subject to ever evolving network and client changes.*

\*\*\*\*

title: MEV access on Ropsten testnet (pre-release)
body:
> Due to increased community interest, this is a pre-released guide on how to test mev-boost on Ropsten testnet.

*Shoutout to [realbigsean](https://github.com/realbigsean) from SigmaPrime for his guidance and insights and [Yorick](https://github.com/yorickdowne) from EthStaker for feedback and review*

***\*\*\*Disclaimer\*\*\****

* ***You are about to touch code under active development which has NOT yet hit the* â€˜*unstableâ€™ branch of Lighthouse.***
* ***Moreover, you will need to self-build the required Docker image (see â€˜Interludeâ€™ section below). It has been tested with a specific Git commit.***
* ***This guide will be updated (and simplified) as soon as corresponding official unstable/stable Docker images by SigmaPrime will have been published.***
* ***Lighthouse Devs are thankful for community feedback, e.g. in their [Discord](https://discord.gg/cyAszAh).***


---

*This post aims to provide a quick and minimalistic setup guide on how to test accessing MEV as a validator on the Ropsten testnet.*

*[In a preceding guide](https://mirror.xyz/ladislaus.eth/O5bW3rDnKITHlCXE9K_0IwiEwDrc6qw-y3MpX0EUcew) I tried to highlight essential requirements for running an Ethereum node post-merge using Ubuntu & Docker. With* `mev-boost` *as an optional, additional piece of software in the node stack, I try to leverage* `docker-compose` *this time.*

## MEVvvhatâ€¦?!

Maximum Extractable Value is a controversial topic within the Ethereum ecosystem. As the network has experienced increased adoption and settlement value, profitable opportunities to insert TXs at particular places of a block have become more prevalent.

These practices are often referred to as *front-running*, among others, implying centralisation vectors and even chain instabilities. Hence, the ultimate goal for blockchain R&D is to minimize (or eliminate?!) such negative externalities for users and the network as a whole. A first step towards mitigating them is to democratize access to MEV.

> In essence, MEV boils down to the fundamental question of how the process of fair transaction ordering in a block is supposed to happen in the most trust-minimised fashion.

Technically, a validator -representing the proposer of a block- defaults to asking the local Execution Layer Client for a particular transaction order (typically ranked by the highest paying TX fees). However, thereâ€™s also the option to ask a third-party **relay** for a pre-constructed block, e.g. [Flashbots](https://docs.flashbots.net/), a collective operating an external block builder protocol. A relay is a doubly-trusted intermediary matching specialised builders on the one hand with validators on the other hand.

![src: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/flashbots/mev-boost/main/docs/mev-boost-integration-overview.png?&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&size=medium)

Node operators can access MEV with the help of a software called `mev-boost` by Flashbots. In the given case, if itâ€™s the validatorâ€™s turn to propose a block, the CL client Lighthouse will ask both mev-boost and the EL client Besu for a block, ultimately opting for the better paying one.

*Note:*

* *At the time of writing no one is sending transaction bundles to the Flashbots relay on Ropsten (i.e. there are no more valuable blocks from the relay to process)*
* *In case a relay provided the validator with an invalid block (header), which turned out to be invalid after the validator client had signed it, this does **not** represent a slashable event (rather leads to a missed proposal).*

Read about how [Flashbots argues for running mev-boost](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost). And feel free to dive deeper into the woods [here](https://twitter.com/lightclients/status/1533915131536605185), [here](https://youtu.be/vhxIjEnhutw) and [here](https://youtu.be/OD54WfVuDWw). Thereâ€™s a bunch of open social, technical and cryptoeconomic research and design questions to be tackled.


---

### Interlude: self-build the Lighthouse Docker image locally

> *This step can be omitted as soon as the necessary code will have been included in the unstable branch of the Lighthouse repository.*

**1)** Navigate in a CLI into your `/home` directory. Download the proper source files from a given Github repository and a given commit hash (*has been tested*):

*More adventurous users could try out later commits on [this branch](https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/tree/pre-bellatrix-blinded-blocks). They might not be stable, however, as it is currently under active development.*

```
$ git clone -n https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/; cd lighthouse
$ git checkout d12d03b2b0165e67f5ebc63db575d8925ddf05c5
```

**2)** Build the docker image (may take some time):

```
$ docker build . -t lighthouse:mevboost-develop
```


---

## How to access MEV on Ropsten

For the sake of this demo, I chose Besu by ConsenSys as an EL client. It comes with a lean new database structure called [â€œBonsai triesâ€ and offers implicit pruning functionality](https://consensys.net/blog/news/test-staking-ahead-of-the-merge-with-improved-bonsai-tries-state-storage/), lowering disk space usage and avoiding potential downtimes for manual pruning. Snap sync is also about to hit the latest release. Lighthouse by SigmaPrime serves as CL client (i.e. Beacon Node & Validator Client).

### Prerequisites

* [Ubuntu & pre-installed docker compose](https://eth-docker.net/docs/Usage/Prerequisites/#ubuntu-prerequisites)
* [A validator keystore for Ropsten](https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-ropsten.md#trying-the-ropsten-testnet)
* Specify [--suggested-fee-recipient](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/suggested-fee-recipient.html)
* *Optionally* modify the data directories that get mounted from the host into the Besu/Lighthouse docker containers

### Run a complete node stack with mev-boost

**1)** Navigate to your `/home` directory. Create a project directory with subfolders:

```
$ mkdir -p ETHclient/{besu,lighthouse-bn,lighthouse-vc,validator_keys,JWT}; cd ETHclient
```

**2)** Generate a [JasonWebToken (JWT)](https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/05/30/ropsten-merge-announcement/) in order for the EL and CL client to communicate securely:

```
$ openssl rand -hex 32 | tr -d "\n" > "$(pwd)/JWT/jwtsecret"
```

**3)** Paste the validator keystore(s) in the host directory `./validator_keys`

**4)** [Add the validator key to Lighthouse](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/validator-import-launchpad.html#docker)

```
$ docker run -it -v $(pwd)/lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse -v $(pwd)/validator_keys:/validator_keys lighthouse:mevboost-develop lighthouse --network ropsten account validator import --directory /validator_keys
```

**5)** Copy & Paste the below attached docker-compose code in a newly created file to be named `besu-lh-mevboost.yaml` in the project directory.

**6)** Start the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten up -d
```

**7)** Eventually, stop the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten stop
```


---

```yaml
version: "3.0"

services:
    beacon_node:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-bn
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-bn:/root/.lighthouse
            - ./JWT:/JWT            
        ports:
            - 9000:9000/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 9000:9000/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          beacon_node
          --datadir /root/.lighthouse/ropsten
          --eth1
          --http
          --http-address 0.0.0.0
          --http-allow-sync-stalled
          --merge
          --metrics
          --eth1-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8545
          --execution-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8551
          --jwt-secrets /JWT/jwtsecret
          --builder http://ropsten-mevboost:18550
          
    validator_client:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-vc
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse
        depends_on:
            - beacon_node
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          validator
          --metrics
          --metrics-address 0.0.0.0
          --beacon-nodes http://ropsten-bn:5052
          --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          --private-tx-proposals
        
    execution_client:
        image: hyperledger/besu:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-besu
        restart: on-failure
        environment:
            - "JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx4g"
        volumes:
            - ./besu:/opt/besu/data
            - ./JWT:/JWT
        ports:
            - 30303:30303/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 30303:30303/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          --network ropsten
          --data-path /opt/besu/data
          --data-storage-format BONSAI
          --rpc-http-enabled
          --rpc-http-host 0.0.0.0
          --rpc-http-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-http-cors-origins *
          --rpc-ws-enabled
          --rpc-ws-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-ws-host 0.0.0.0   
          --metrics-enabled
          --metrics-host 0.0.0.0
          --host-allowlist *
          --engine-host-allowlist *
          --engine-jwt-enabled
          --engine-jwt-secret /JWT/jwtsecret
        
    mev_boost:
        image: flashbots/mev-boost:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-mevboost
        restart: on-failure
        entrypoint:
            - /app/mev-boost
            - -addr
            - 0.0.0.0:18550
            - -ropsten
            - -relays
            - https://0xb124d80a00b80815397b4e7f1f05377ccc83aeeceb6be87963ba3649f1e6efa32ca870a88845917ec3f26a8e2aa25c77@builder-relay-ropsten.flashbots.net
            
networks:
    ETHclient_net:
        driver: bridge
```

Obviously, the more testnet validators you run, the higher the likelihood of being randomly selected to propose a block (i.e. you likely have to wait less long)

```
level=info msg="getHeader: successfully got more valuable payload header"
```

`https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/<yourblocknumber>`

```yaml
          --datadir /root/.lighthouse/ropsten
          --eth1
          --http
          --http-address 0.0.0.0
          --http-allow-sync-stalled
          --merge
          --metrics
          --eth1-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8545
          --execution-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8551
          --jwt-secrets /JWT/jwtsecret
          --builder http://ropsten-mevboost:18550
          
    validator_client:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-vc
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse
        depends_on:
            - beacon_node
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          validator
          --metrics
          --metrics-address 0.0.0.0
          --beacon-nodes http://ropsten-bn:5052
          --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          --private-tx-proposals
        
    execution_client:
        image: hyperledger/besu:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-besu
        restart: on-failure
        environment:
            - "JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx4g"
        volumes:
            - ./besu:/opt/besu/data
            - ./JWT:/JWT
        ports:
            - 30303:30303/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 30303:30303/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          --network ropsten
          --data-path /opt/besu/data
          --data-storage-format BONSAI
          --rpc-http-enabled
          --rpc-http-host 0.0.0.0
          --rpc-http-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-http-cors-origins *
          --rpc-ws-enabled
          --rpc-ws-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-ws-host 0.0.0.0   
          --metrics-enabled
          --metrics-host 0.0.0.0
          --host-allowlist *
          --engine-host-allowlist *
          --engine-jwt-enabled
          --engine-jwt-secret /JWT/jwtsecret
        
    mev_boost:
        image: flashbots/mev-boost:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-mevboost
        restart: on-failure
        entrypoint:
            - /app/mev-boost
            - -addr
            - 0.0.0.0:18550
            - -ropsten
            - -relays
            - https://0xb124d80a00b80815397b4e7f1f05377ccc83aeeceb6be87963ba3649f1e6efa32ca870a88845917ec3f26a8e2aa25c77@builder-relay-ropsten.flashbots.net
            
networks:
    ETHclient_net:
        driver: bridge
```


---

### Closing Remarks

Obviously, the more testnet validators you run, the higher the likelihood of being randomly selected to propose a block (i.e. you likely have to wait less long)

**Watch out for the following logs in mev-boost:**

```
level=info msg="getHeader: successfully got more valuable payload header"

level=info msg="getPayload: received payload from relay"
```

**And check if your block has made it on-chain:**

`https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/<yourblocknumber>`


---

\*\*\*\*

*Please keep in mind this is a testnet guide that may contain mistakes and that takes shortcuts which come with trade-offs. It could quickly become outdated as itâ€™s subject to ever evolving network and client changes.*

\*\*\*\*

title: MEV access on Ropsten testnet (pre-release)
body:
Due to increased community interest, this is a pre-released guide on how to test mev-boost on Ropsten testnet.

*Shoutout to [realbigsean](https://github.com/realbigsean) from SigmaPrime for his guidance and insights and [Yorick](https://github.com/yorickdowne) from EthStaker for feedback and review*

***\*\*\*Disclaimer\*\*\****

* ***You are about to touch code under active development which has NOT yet hit the* â€˜*unstableâ€™ branch of Lighthouse.***
* ***Moreover, you will need to self-build the required Docker image (see â€˜Interludeâ€™ section below). It has been tested with a specific Git commit.***
* ***This guide will be updated (and simplified) as soon as corresponding official unstable/stable Docker images by SigmaPrime will have been published.***
* ***Lighthouse Devs are thankful for community feedback, e.g. in their [Discord](https://discord.gg/cyAszAh).***


---

*This post aims to provide a quick and minimalistic setup guide on how to test accessing MEV as a validator on the Ropsten testnet.*

*[In a preceding guide](https://mirror.xyz/ladislaus.eth/O5bW3rDnKITHlCXE9K_0IwiEwDrc6qw-y3MpX0EUcew) I tried to highlight essential requirements for running an Ethereum node post-merge using Ubuntu & Docker. With* `mev-boost` *as an optional, additional piece of software in the node stack, I try to leverage* `docker-compose` *this time.*

## MEVvvhatâ€¦?!

Maximum Extractable Value is a controversial topic within the Ethereum ecosystem. As the network has experienced increased adoption and settlement value, profitable opportunities to insert TXs at particular places of a block have become more prevalent.

These practices are often referred to as *front-running*, among others, implying centralisation vectors and even chain instabilities. Hence, the ultimate goal for blockchain R&D is to minimize (or eliminate?!) such negative externalities for users and the network as a whole. A first step towards mitigating them is to democratize access to MEV.

> In essence, MEV boils down to the fundamental question of how the process of fair transaction ordering in a block is supposed to happen in the most trust-minimised fashion.

Technically, a validator -representing the proposer of a block- defaults to asking the local Execution Layer Client for a particular transaction order (typically ranked by the highest paying TX fees). However, thereâ€™s also the option to ask a third-party **relay** for a pre-constructed block, e.g. [Flashbots](https://docs.flashbots.net/), a collective operating an external block builder protocol. A relay is a doubly-trusted intermediary matching specialised builders on the one hand with validators on the other hand.

![src: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/flashbots/mev-boost/main/docs/mev-boost-integration-overview.png?&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&size=medium)

Node operators can access MEV with the help of a software called `mev-boost` by Flashbots. In the given case, if itâ€™s the validatorâ€™s turn to propose a block, the CL client Lighthouse will ask both mev-boost and the EL client Besu for a block, ultimately opting for the better paying one.

*Note:*

* *At the time of writing no one is sending transaction bundles to the Flashbots relay on Ropsten (i.e. there are no more valuable blocks from the relay to process)*
* *In case a relay provided the validator with an invalid block (header), which turned out to be invalid after the validator client had signed it, this does **not** represent a slashable event (rather leads to a missed proposal).*

Read about how [Flashbots argues for running mev-boost](https://writings.flashbots.net/writings/why-run-mevboost). And feel free to dive deeper into the woods [here](https://twitter.com/lightclients/status/1533915131536605185), [here](https://youtu.be/vhxIjEnhutw) and [here](https://youtu.be/OD54WfVuDWw). Thereâ€™s a bunch of open social, technical and cryptoeconomic research and design questions to be tackled.


---

### Interlude: self-build the Lighthouse Docker image locally

> *This step can be omitted as soon as the necessary code will have been included in the unstable branch of the Lighthouse repository.*

**1)** Navigate in a CLI into your `/home` directory. Download the proper source files from a given Github repository and a given commit hash (*has been tested*):

*More adventurous users could try out later commits on [this branch](https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/tree/pre-bellatrix-blinded-blocks). They might not be stable, however, as it is currently under active development.*

```
$ git clone -n https://github.com/realbigsean/lighthouse/; cd lighthouse
$ git checkout d12d03b2b0165e67f5ebc63db575d8925ddf05c5
```

**2)** Build the docker image (may take some time):

```
$ docker build . -t lighthouse:mevboost-develop
```


---

## How to access MEV on Ropsten

For the sake of this demo, I chose Besu by ConsenSys as an EL client. It comes with a lean new database structure called [â€œBonsai triesâ€ and offers implicit pruning functionality](https://consensys.net/blog/news/test-staking-ahead-of-the-merge-with-improved-bonsai-tries-state-storage/), lowering disk space usage and avoiding potential downtimes for manual pruning. Snap sync is also about to hit the latest release. Lighthouse by SigmaPrime serves as CL client (i.e. Beacon Node & Validator Client).

### Prerequisites

* [Ubuntu & pre-installed docker compose](https://eth-docker.net/docs/Usage/Prerequisites/#ubuntu-prerequisites)
* [A validator keystore for Ropsten](https://github.com/remyroy/ethstaker/blob/main/merge-ropsten.md#trying-the-ropsten-testnet)
* Specify [--suggested-fee-recipient](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/suggested-fee-recipient.html)
* *Optionally* modify the data directories that get mounted from the host into the Besu/Lighthouse docker containers

### Run a complete node stack with mev-boost

**1)** Navigate to your `/home` directory. Create a project directory with subfolders:

```
$ mkdir -p ETHclient/{besu,lighthouse-bn,lighthouse-vc,validator_keys,JWT}; cd ETHclient
```

**2)** Generate a [JasonWebToken (JWT)](https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/05/30/ropsten-merge-announcement/) in order for the EL and CL client to communicate securely:

```
$ openssl rand -hex 32 | tr -d "\n" > "$(pwd)/JWT/jwtsecret"
```

**3)** Paste the validator keystore(s) in the host directory `./validator_keys`

**4)** [Add the validator key to Lighthouse](https://lighthouse-book.sigmaprime.io/validator-import-launchpad.html#docker)

```
$ docker run -it -v $(pwd)/lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse -v $(pwd)/validator_keys:/validator_keys lighthouse:mevboost-develop lighthouse --network ropsten account validator import --directory /validator_keys
```

**5)** Copy & Paste the below attached docker-compose code in a newly created file to be named `besu-lh-mevboost.yaml` in the project directory.

**6)** Start the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten up -d
```

**7)** Eventually, stop the docker-compose environment:

```
$ docker-compose -f besu-lh-mevboost.yaml -p ropsten stop
```


---

```yml
version: "3.0"

services:
    beacon_node:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-bn
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-bn:/root/.lighthouse
            - ./JWT:/JWT            
        ports:
            - 9000:9000/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 9000:9000/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          beacon_node
          --datadir /root/.lighthouse/ropsten
          --eth1
          --http
          --http-address 0.0.0.0
          --http-allow-sync-stalled
          --merge
          --metrics
          --eth1-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8545
          --execution-endpoints http://ropsten-besu:8551
          --jwt-secrets /JWT/jwtsecret
          --builder http://ropsten-mevboost:18550
          
    validator_client:
        image: lighthouse:mevboost-develop
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-vc
        restart: on-failure
        volumes:
            - ./lighthouse-vc:/root/.lighthouse
        depends_on:
            - beacon_node
        command: >
          lighthouse
          --debug-level info
          --network ropsten
          validator
          --metrics
          --metrics-address 0.0.0.0
          --beacon-nodes http://ropsten-bn:5052
          --suggested-fee-recipient 0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000000
          --private-tx-proposals
        
    execution_client:
        image: hyperledger/besu:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-besu
        restart: on-failure
        environment:
            - "JAVA_OPTS=-Xmx4g"
        volumes:
            - ./besu:/opt/besu/data
            - ./JWT:/JWT
        ports:
            - 30303:30303/tcp # consensus p2p, open to internet
            - 30303:30303/udp # consensus p2p, open to internet
        command: >
          --network ropsten
          --data-path /opt/besu/data
          --data-storage-format BONSAI
          --rpc-http-enabled
          --rpc-http-host 0.0.0.0
          --rpc-http-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-http-cors-origins *
          --rpc-ws-enabled
          --rpc-ws-api WEB3,ETH,NET
          --rpc-ws-host 0.0.0.0   
          --metrics-enabled
          --metrics-host 0.0.0.0
          --host-allowlist *
          --engine-host-allowlist *
          --engine-jwt-enabled
          --engine-jwt-secret /JWT/jwtsecret
        
    mev_boost:
        image: flashbots/mev-boost:latest
        networks:
            - ETHclient_net
        container_name: ropsten-mevboost
        restart: on-failure
        entrypoint:
            - /app/mev-boost
            - -addr
            - 0.0.0.0:18550
            - -ropsten
            - -relays
            - https://0xb124d80a00b80815397b4e7f1f05377ccc83aeeceb6be87963ba3649f1e6efa32ca870a88845917ec3f26a8e2aa25c77@builder-relay-ropsten.flashbots.net
            
networks:
    ETHclient_net:
        driver: bridge
```


---

### Closing Remarks

Obviously, the more testnet validators you run, the higher the likelihood of being randomly selected to propose a block (i.e. you likely have to wait less long)

**Watch out for the following logs in mev-boost:**

```
level=info msg="getHeader: successfully got more valuable payload header"

level=info msg="getPayload: received payload from relay"
```

**And check if your block has made it on-chain:**

`https://ropsten.etherscan.io/block/<yourblocknumber>`


---

\*\*\*\*

*Please keep in mind this is a testnet guide that may contain mistakes and that takes shortcuts which come with trade-offs. It could quickly become outdated as itâ€™s subject to ever evolving network and client changes.*

title: Angelicism01: Collected Commentaries on Milady
body:
Collected coverage from [Angelicism01](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/) on Milady from Summer 2021 to Summer 2022 in reverse chronological order.


---

# THIS IS HOW WE ALL WENT EXTINCT ONLINE

*theoretical gossip from the pov of the late 21st century*

**5-28-22: [Link](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/helen-keller-is-not-fucking-real) ([Archive](https://archive.ph/n6kyd))**

> Extinction is rly the hot topic girl Like biospheric collapse bootsâ€”angelicism01archive2 ig (scraped from personal dms) May 2022

> â¤¹â‹†â¸™ÍÛªÛ«ï½¡ËšÛ°Ëšâ˜½Ëšâ€â·ï½¡Ëšâ¸™ÍÛªÛ«â‹† à¼„ è¶…ç™½ä¸¸.Â·Í™\*Ì©Ì©Í™ËšÌ©Ì¥Ì©Ì¥\*Ì©Ì©Ì¥Í™ã€€âœ©ã€€\*Ì©Ì©Ì¥Í™ËšÌ©Ì¥Ì©Ì¥\*Ì©Ì©Í™â€§Í™ â€”@E777InHeaven, internet inscription \[legend\] 28 May 2022

> Vincent Gallo is a â€˜retardâ€™â€”angelicism summer tee inscription \[legend\] late summer 2022, angelicism fashion unit summer spring 01

**THIS IS HOW WE ALL DIED, THIS IS HOW WE ALL DIED ON THE INTERNET.** This is how we went extinct online in 2022.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F756709ac-7aa6-439a-827c-4df239b5c845_1024x682.jpeg)

***THIS IS how we all died on the Internet in the 2020s****: Clandestino triangle is a pilgrimage site visited to perform ritual omnilapse. Justin Murphy and Ryder Ripps are using the corpse of Milady as a specular battleground. Pulling the plug on something thatâ€™s â€˜making itself smarterâ€™ is a candidate for the ultimate crime.*

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fd4f438ea-116b-4b88-8b99-24852d8d9e44_828x468.jpeg)

**I cum hardest in corpse pose Whatâ€™s that? My username?**

**She is a poet who plays oscillators live**

**and reads more AGI news than all the bros**

**who left math academia to trade private prison stock combined.**

***These are the IntelligenceWarsâ„¢, the wars over inscription.*** Whatâ€™s at stake is a nonrelative holocaust to come. This is how it all went down:

> *You did it, you went and killed infinity. # NO MILADY NFTS, NOT NOW: THE RETURN OF 'SIYUAN ZHAO' AS THE NIGHT OF THE LIVING EXTINCT

*Will the Milady Wave create even more New Slaves? Is the Vibe Shift now cosmically fallen off? Why so serious?*

**08-28-21: [Link](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-milady-nfts-not-now-the-return) ([Archive](https://archive.ph/yqSr9))**

> *Cotton was often likened to white gold.*â€”Anna Arabindan-Kesson

> *The Internet epoch, we learn, is the Golden Age of masks.*â€”Nick Land

> *Watching an hour of Netflix is estimated to be around 36 gCO2. Thatâ€™s 6000 times lower than an average single-edition NFT.*â€”Memo Akten

**NAH MILADY TWEAKIN (ERRONEOUS, BUT INEVITABLE)**

Earlier this year I wrote an essay called â€˜[NO NFTS, NOT NOW: THE RETURN OF POST-INTERNET ART AS THE NIGHT OF THE LIVING EXTINCT](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-nfts-not-now-the-return-of-post)â€™. Its argument was relatively simple and consisted of two parts:

* *NFTs are already the very worst thing that can happen to art and so need to be resisted (the sunken eco-cost argument).* \[1\]
* *NFTs are inevitable, will accelerate, and cannot be resisted (mitigation/transition to Web3 argument).*

Anyone who read the whole essay might have recognised *both* parts of an impossible complaint. Taken together, they amounted to something like a *non-negative* critique of the extinctive momentum of *all* digital-aesthetic tropes and alibis. \[2\] I meant to register the genuine shift that NFTs present but also the internal (not subject to correction, for reasons that can be demonstrated) challenge to energy continuity. As regards Neochibi or Milady NFTsâ€”which I find deeply alluringâ€”one might say the contradiction is even more *acute*.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/86ljANv31SNcxyUKpXJTc.png?height=326&width=886)

Instead of adding an endless debate on the specifics of NFTs *as drain* (â€˜gas pricesâ€™), here is a quasi-random series of â€˜classicâ€™ Twitter threads/discussions on the subject: \[[1](https://twitter.com/sterlingcrispin/status/1363904967937986561)\], \[[2](https://twitter.com/jmrphy/status/1363578300166119424)\], \[[3](https://twitter.com/matdryhurst/status/1362826350055346176)\], \[[4](https://twitter.com/Outsideness/status/906933391802621953)\], \[[5](https://twitter.com/chrismartz/status/1362791772808638471)\], \[[6](https://twitter.com/matdryhurst/status/1359911025852768258)\], \[[7](https://twitter.com/mikerugnetta/status/1362758566126514177)\],Â [\[8](https://twitter.com/memotv/status/1358047173896724481)\], \[[9](https://twitter.com/memotv/status/1308683955705655296)\], \[[10](https://twitter.com/memotv/status/1352007593535954948)\], \[[11](https://twitter.com/smdiehl/status/1350869944888664064)\], \[[12](https://twitter.com/JoanieLemercier/status/1362186410363654146)\], \[[13](https://twitter.com/lizpelly/status/1362460463179718662)\], \[[14](https://twitter.com/NegarestaniReza/status/1362558046338232322)\], \[[15](https://twitter.com/timmaughan/status/1362503110292369410)\], \[[16](https://twitter.com/ddaavvee1234/status/1363132957163143168)\], \[[17](https://twitter.com/jstn/status/1363155967844753408)\], \[[18](https://twitter.com/jackdanger/status/1363174689925787649)\], \[[19](https://twitter.com/anguschampion/status/1366702927100977153)\], \[[20](https://twitter.com/everestpipkin/status/1331178373809311744?s=20)\], \[[21](https://twitter.com/ElfJTrul/status/1365483101586006016)\], \[[22](https://twitter.com/charliebcurran/status/1367005385035575296)\], \[[23](https://twitter.com/everestpipkin/status/1367253353571483652)\], \[[24](https://twitter.com/LILINTERNET/status/1366461272460509185)\], \[[25](https://twitter.com/LILINTERNET/status/1365322876556034052)\], \[[26](https://twitter.com/DnlKlr/status/1367777481768505348)\], \[[27](https://twitter.com/David_Rudnick/status/1367145493818712064)\]. \[[28](https://twitter.com/avocado_ibprfn/status/1367181865732493314)\], \[[29](https://twitter.com/itskindred/status/1369726765359304707)\], \[[30](https://twitter.com/NegarestaniReza/status/1370833861555458048)\], \[[31](https://twitter.com/peligrietzer/status/1372287963103641605)\], \[[32](https://twitter.com/LapsusLima/status/1372071119629348866)\], \[[33](https://twitter.com/jonty/status/1372163423446917122)\], \[[34](https://twitter.com/KBULTRA0/status/1374274990170853377)\], \[[35](https://twitter.com/Cryptoyieldinfo/status/1381094492502073348)\], \[[36](https://twitter.com/yassineARK/status/1360343382556483587)\], \[[37](https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1392602041025843203)\], \[[38](https://twitter.com/DnlKlr/status/1392822573344468993)\], \[[39](https://twitter.com/DnlKlr/status/1389204987964764162)\], \[[40](https://twitter.com/DnlKlr/status/1389205329515266053)\], \[[41](https://twitter.com/i/events/1393199540644290560)\], \[[42](https://twitter.com/DnlKlr/status/1393829232728551424)\]. Feel free to peruse. This issue of â€˜gasâ€™ needs to be *assumed* as at the very least *contentious* for what follows.

**KANTIAN ANGELIC MIND**

A further paradox in the original NFT essay was that according to one of the most evolved theorists of crypto in its *philosophical* aspectsâ€”Nick Landâ€”the release triggered by digital money inside technological signatures and rationality is itself angelicist in mood.

In his *[Crypto-Current](https://etscrivner.github.io/cryptocurrent/)* text, Land writes:

> AI is thus positioned, implicitly, in the place of a Kantian angelic mind, liberated from the anthopomorphic proscription upon direct self-modification of its own cognitive processes.

In other words, though we may expect the achievements of crypto-intelligence to consist of release from theogenic tropes, some of those tropesâ€”specifically, angelicismâ€”are already the height of what any digital shift can achieve.

Pure money as achieved rationality is also pure angelicism. There is nothing to update beyond angelism as rationality itself. Angelicism is the unupdateable. We are already as artificially intelligent as we can be. It (angelicism) is it.

The implication for NFT production is as radical as it is superfluous. That is, it will beâ€”radicallyâ€”ignored.

And yet, the implication *cannot not be* named. It *cannot not be* iterated, just as NFTs *cannot not be* producedâ€”both momentums, if you like, are part of the same essentially entropic ass vibes of aesthetic â€˜historyâ€™ rn.

**THE IMPLICATION**

The implication can be stated in terms of poetic cognition. Paul de Man said that when you see beautiful poetry itâ€™s almost impossible to resist, and not your fault for going ahead and (not) doing so, but it doesnâ€™t mean beautiful poetry is not lethal.

The same can be said of the spread of NFTs, and their latest â€˜Miladyâ€™ manifestationâ€”the beauty, fun, and unsummarisability of this Neochibi trend may be pictured in the context of [a water cooler in Treblinka](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-nfts-not-now-the-return-of-post). It is itselfâ€”holocaustically, impossibly, glossilyâ€”*fun*.

This perhaps sounds like nothing (everything) but it is probably everything (nothing) that nobody wants to think. We are saying that this argument about the extinction-costs (see links above) of all art right now willâ€”by definitionâ€”be ignored.

The brain of history does not and cannot read this *as what it sees* more than anything else in 2021. *It* is addicted to *its* indifference. NFTs are the summation of an indifference to indifference (â€˜funâ€™) and little else.

![One translation: the suicidal ideology of digital tropes (shades) is no different to 20th century abstract art knitwear (Rothkoâ€™s suicide). But the images taken togetherÂ areâ€”even nowâ€”impossibly attractive. \[Open-eyedness. The endearingness of a naÃ¯ve financial set theory, etc. One can ofc multiplyÂ justifications.\]](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F2f9156d0-11f1-4b5a-9bd6-0f482a77f239_915x787.png)

Tom Cohenâ€”the only real *theorist* of extinctionâ€”calls this lethal implication the *literary character of climate change*. That is, instead of culture being the exception to industrial civilisationâ€™s extinction drive, it is the central motor. It is cultureâ€”and online culture especiallyâ€”that above all will soon have killed us all.

This connotes that all great art is nowâ€”intensely, and not just contingentlyâ€”more-than-lethal. Which is to say, *profoundly* pedantic. That is the angelicist position, if there is one. And it is what makes angelicism a claim on the nonpedantic zone (pending, lacking, time).

**MORE AND MORE NFTS**

In the first â€˜No More NFTSâ€™ essay there was *zero expectation* that there would be . . . no more NFTs. The opposite was the case:

> *It is as impossible to heckle this development as it is to embrace it* \[our emphasis\]. A *degree* of abstinence may, at this point, be the only form of deception thatâ€™s *almost* dignified. Art criticismâ€™s rage at Crypto Art is no less empty than the worst of the art itself: passive nostalgia as the flipside of necrotic decadence, ass beating Priapus who kills it as reply.

A *critique* of Milady cannot be offered because Milady, no less than Beepleâ€™s *Dick Milking Factory* (2021), is as erroneous as it is inevitable. The two sides cannot be separated out. Neochibiâ€™s is Priapusâ€™ secret flip.

Where Beepleâ€™s art was priapic and therefore risible, Miladyâ€™s incoming wave will be as if well defended and hard to object to because of its cuddly post-ironic just-chillin cuteness. How can anyone want to trample on a tiny fairy factory, however invisibly canny and candied?

**NFTS IN AUGUST 2021, OR, MILADY IN TREBLINKA**

To recap, towards the end of August 2021 the â€˜miladyâ€™ phenomenon which had been in trial-state for a while was launched by the approximate Network Spirituality and Remilia group. Milady is, simply, an avatar meme generator of supreme sweetness. Put like that, it sounds non-mysterious. Just some innocent Gremlins, this time without the tragic add-water fault.

The official description of Milady Maker is of â€˜a collection of 10,000 generative pfp NFTs in a neochibi aesthetic inspired by street style tribesâ€™.[3](https://cashedcobrazhousewriter.substack.com/p/no-milady-nfts-not-now-the-return#footnote-3)

At one level, these image-contracts are obviously the inheritance of [the Miya Siyuan Zhao pfp proliferation](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY) that peaked between 2019 and 2020, but this time hooked up to what is ultimately already an obsolescent NFT technology. Last time, it was â€˜Kaliaccâ€™ that felt prohibitive next to the images, this time itâ€™s â€˜gas pricesâ€™. The confusion is itself the ideological selling point.

Throughout 2021 Network Spirituality loosely positioned itself as anti-paywall (when it came to Substack) and anti-deadnaming (when it came to avatars), but it has also developed an increasing nonhomogenous interest in NFT technology, now flourishing as the pfpNFT Generator whose results have already been adopted casually by e.g. Mat Dryhurst, a figure in mainstream crypto â€˜interdependenceâ€™ theorisation and so on.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ku5sYvJJpi0Wn0f3-97F3.png?height=288&width=876)

One may of course ask questions of how an anti-paywall ethos fits with the use of NFTs, but thatâ€™s not necessarily the most interesting aspect (everyone is contradictory, finance is infinite complicity, etc). De Man notes that the scopic manipulability of blindness in aesthetic zones is not really a human thing anyway. Its inevitability means that, however costly, it literally cannot be *subjectively* adjusted or seen (even right now, right here at this moment of reading).

Even ifâ€”or especially ifâ€”I know NFT technology can vastly accelerate the already prohibitive costs of global art, I am also incapable, as *normative* subject, of *not* forgetting this. In fact, the forgetting is the first thing that art needs to *be* art. Precisely what is *exponentially* [â€˜normalâ€™](https://twitter.com/CharlieFang77/status/1431183749023027201) for art in 2021 is that art be indifferent to the extremity of extinction.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2Fb84b21fc-c3e0-455b-99f1-74afb2ea6db5_500x620.png)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/O6nbU0ZQP1zCawlf6VwSd.png?height=390&width=872)

Here is how de Man expressed the bind:

> Rather than putting it in terms that suggest deceit and duplicity, one could say that the poet, like the philosopher, must *forget* what he knows about his undertaking in order to accede to the discourse to which he is committed.

No one artist is responsible for the extincto-collaborative nature of contemporary crypto artâ€”after, for some, â€˜the vibe shiftâ€™â€”but this is not to say (some) *one* does not know what the cost is, and that there is no risk in calling it (as an empty allegorical IYKYK â€˜jokeâ€™) â€˜normalâ€™. Since one can do nothing, the temptation is to treble down into the forgetting, as if the layer in which the art is made is itself amnesia.

But since one can only remain disturbed by the (un)consciousness of forgetting, it is a delusion to think one has entirely forgotten. This illusion itselfâ€”increasingly normal, so it seemsâ€”is also increasingly *what is sold*. The â€˜normalâ€™â€”HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA, as the laughters low of neoMaladyKaliacc would admitâ€”turns out to be the new holocaust to come.

**HOW TO GET FROM â€˜SIYUAN ZHAOâ€™ TO NEOCHIBI TO TREBLINKA GOLD**

> It follows (in accordance with a priori synthesis) that a robust cryptocurrency will take the form of artificial gold.â€”Nick Land, *Crypto-Current*

It is impossible to think of digital art and not think of Gold at some point, for example Pindarâ€™s holy Gold in Heidegger as a name for Being or what Land calls â€˜artificial goldâ€™. It is impossible to think of Gold without eventually thinkingâ€”at some obscure point in consciousness and its corruptionâ€”of the figure of â€˜the Jewâ€™. Perhaps deeper and more controversial still, the NFT market seems to create New Slaves. Kanye knew this by surmise, and itâ€™s not a point that demands the pedantic detailism of examples. (In the zone of art as it is, *detailism* increases the everyday devil.)

Everyone at least knows that in some point in the pastâ€”so long ago!!! like 2020â€”an absolute value was attached to something called â€˜anti-capitalâ€™. The strange fact is that in America, under Biden, the power of such a â€˜resistanceâ€™ is less than ever apparent. The artificial Gold Rush is slaying the normative tribe.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F2f74953b-9e3d-4684-9efd-848417a03af4_500x625.jpeg)

Can we imagine a Milady in Treblinka and should we? To do so is to place art in a proximity to genocide so obtrusive that it begs the severe hopefree question. In the first â€˜No NFTSâ€™ essay, the comparison of an artwork with a â€˜watercooler in Treblinkaâ€™ was just that egregious display. But NFTs are already acutely *historical*, so how *not* so serious? Or why and how *pause* entrapped inside the beauty of normative oblivion?

The camps are meant to be an exception, even now, even given a world of constant forgetting of â€˜never forgetâ€™. Where Siyuan Zhao had an aggressive relation with art itself (Miami, and so on), Milady is almost all cute amnesia and its fun-law, the indifference to indifference and shine shrine. No blood this time.

![](https://substackcdn.com/image/fetch/w_1456,c_limit,f_auto,q_auto:good,fl_progressive:steep/https%3A%2F%2Fbucketeer-e05bbc84-baa3-437e-9518-adb32be77984.s3.amazonaws.com%2Fpublic%2Fimages%2F27993612-d965-421a-a3d0-7194faa31bb1_1200x800.jpeg)

To say Milady cannot be pictured in Treblinka or at Miami Beach because it is offensive is to make it impossible to ever again take total human genocide seriously as a category. If angelicism is a formal gesture, it is the gesture of pushing back against the illusion that anything can or should be put ahead of what Grothendieck calls the â€˜infinite quantityâ€™ and pricelessness of the current species on earth (humanimal). Angelicism places itself, at almost all costs, between the human and the â€˜something elseâ€™ of absolute niche finality (cosmic burn-all). It counts holocausts (impossibly).

To be nonpedantic, this means having to bear the thought that Jewishness and the Holocaust cannot be at the centre of any contemporary account of pain. On the contrary. Moreover, this would be the point of imagining Milady in Treblinka, to bring up that immense problem of relativisation. The problem is not just that there is more than one holocaust depending on who you ask culturally, but that the threat of total extinction is in fact a greater matheme. Besides, surely little Milady is *ready*.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY&feature=emb_title](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vWMDchOVqjY&feature=emb_title)

Even if it is inevitable that we increasingly ignore the following fact, there is, according to at least one market pitch, nothing more worthy of speculation than the *holocaust to come*.

**DIGITAL CHRIST**

> By 2035, demand is expected to double for germanium; quadruple for tantalum; and quintuple for palladium. The scandium market could increase nine-fold, and the cobalt market by a factor of 24.â€”Guillaume Pitron

So, what *is* network spirituality? Will it turn out to be a value? Or, conversely, are all the angels of heaven a spoilsport distraction from falling in love with Digital Christâ€™s actual eyes?

Let us say there is such a thing as _non_minting, both in life and art. There is radical purity, perhaps, and radical emptiness. There is Angelic mind and there are non-networks. Land makes a reference to Mou Zongsan and â€˜the Eastâ€™, crucially, in the section ofÂ *Crypto-Current*Â that discusses â€˜Kantian angelic mindâ€™. Here is what he says:

> The practical actualization of intellectual intuition is modeledâ€”spontaneouslyâ€”as an explosion because it is comparable to the withdrawal of graphite rods controlling a nuclear fission reaction. An inhibitor is removed. In the East, the catalysis of â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ through methodical subtraction of an obstacle is no less pointedly thematized, even if it is approached from the other side, and in the opposite direction.

In effect, Kantian angelic mind (angelicism as pure time and purchase and price) is available without the support of Western method-objects. As Land puts it, â€˜enlightenmentâ€™ is valorised from the other side, that is, the side originally with no (â€˜digitalâ€™) network as such. The subtraction of an obstacle (the nonpedantic) does the thing we want beyond or before what AI or the internet yet can. The true internet, letâ€™s say, is ancient, and the only thing of great price.

### Footnotes

1. A really expensive hyperlink with an absurd carbon footprint, etc.
2. I call this nonpedantic rendition of overness ubilapse.
3. A more detailed description is found here: â€˜Milady Maker is a collection of 10,000 generative pfpNFTâ€™s in a neochibi aesthetic with randomized cosmetics inspired by 00â€™s Tokyo street fashion. Under the vision of digital artist Milady Sonora, Miladyâ€™s are designed to be fashion-minded and genuinely good social media avatars, and an invitation into their personal aesthetic world.â€™
